programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tia and the team discover a dog has been abandoned in a nearby playground in searing heat. Lizzy makes an emergency trip to save a dog hit by a car

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: The rescue centres oldest resident, a pit bull with severe arthritis, is rehomed. Earl works to improve a dogs social skills and Kananis girlfriend takes on her first rescue

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: The crew of Era Alaska provide aid to a village devastated by flooding. Two pilots get lost off the Russian coast while delivering ammunition, and Jims Cessna 180 goes up in smoke

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Ariel takes to the skies in a new plane - with dangerous results. Meanwhile, lead pilot Erik Snuggerud battles heavy turbulence as he transports a special delivery

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson revisits two builds in need of major makeovers, setting about reconstructing and revitalising this pair of treehouses to bring them back to their former glory

programme.title: Bad Dog!
programme.desc: A dog that keeps chasing an ice-cream van, a cat that steals food and destroys its owners house, and a rabbit that keeps wreaking havoc in the fridge

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: More secrets from the animal kingdom, including why moths are attracted to flames, why turtles cry and why sea otters bond with stones

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Experts spill the secrets of the animal kingdom, revealing why spiders dont get stuck in their own webs and how foxes find water in the desert

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: The team is in Madagascar to study the recently discovered Goodmans mouse lemur. One of the worlds smallest primates, it is incredible agile and ferocious

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: Bradley and Billy are hunting for dragons deep in the rainforests of Thailand. The flying dragon rules the jungle canopy, gliding and dive-bombing its prey

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Cardiologists try to determine why the geladas are experiencing a life-threatening heart condition. After a shaky start, the elephant shrews are breeding

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Director Kevin Smith, one half of Hollywood comedy duo Jay and Silent Bob, seeks a new home for two turtles and a tortoise, giving Brett and Wayde a new, challenging job

programme.title: Life After: Chernobyl
programme.desc: Scientists with unlimited access to the Chernobyl danger zone explore how the environment and wildlife are affected after 30 years in the most contaminated area on earth

programme.title: Fish or Die
programme.desc: In Mexico, the crew navigate a maze of crocodile and mosquito-infested waterways and lagoons in search of a rumoured paradise for fishing tarpon

programme.title: Saved by the Barn

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.sub-title: Where Theres Water Theres a Way
programme.desc: As the siblings race to finish their water system, Billy gets news that shakes the Wolfpack. Bear goes hunting and reflects on a big life decision

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: The team is in Madagascar to study the recently discovered Goodmans mouse lemur. One of the worlds smallest primates, it is incredible agile and ferocious

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: Bradley and Billy are hunting for dragons deep in the rainforests of Thailand. The flying dragon rules the jungle canopy, gliding and dive-bombing its prey

programme.title: The Zoo

programme.title: The Flying Gardener
programme.desc: Chris Beardshaw visits a Loch Fyne oyster fisherman who needs help with his overgrown shady garden, and finds out why Scots design the best shady gardens

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: A retired sheepdog takes to rounding up cars, and James is challenged to a race. Rural drama based on the novels of James Herriot, starring Christopher Timothy, Peter Davison and Robert Hardy

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Television arrives in the Dales, and Siegfried thinks he is the ideal candidate to treat a dog with a weak heart. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy

programme.title: The Intruder
programme.desc: Having come to the end of her maternity leave, Paula prepares to return to a demanding job at a start-up company. She and her husband Jerôme decide to hire an au pair and recruit Tess, a polished and personable young woman, who gets on wonderfully with the baby and their two teenagers. But Paula experiences increasing feelings of unease as strange domestic incidents start to multiply, casting her in the light of a bad mother. French psychological thriller, starring Melanie Doutey

programme.title: The Intruder
programme.desc: Paulas psychiatrist suggests that she is suffering from postpartum depression and that she should take a leave of absence,. Paula discovers that the nanny they were supposed to interview just before Tess has been assaulted, and her suspicions only grow. Jerôme doesnt share her doubts and the couple are torn apart, rekindling older rifts. French psychological thriller, starring Melanie Doutey

programme.title: Wogan
programme.desc: Terry Wogan is joined by Margaret Baird, Betty Astell, Dickie Bird and Anthony Sher, while ther is music from Aztec Camera and Elio Pace. First broadcast in 1988

programme.title: Dickie Bird: A Rare Species
programme.desc: Harry Gration narrates a 1996 profile of the former cricket umpire, who died last month, looking at his life on and off the field and featuring contributions from well-known faces

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom and Barbara make a small profit and spend the money on a loom, while Margo persuades Jerry to buy her a spinning wheel. Self-sufficiency comedy, starring Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: On his arrival at Number 10, Jim Hacker is confronted by a confusing nuclear deterrent problem, made more difficult by Sir Humphreys constant meddling. The new PM soon realises his powers do not stretch to domestic affairs. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: A retired sheepdog takes to rounding up cars, and James is challenged to a race. Rural drama based on the novels of James Herriot, starring Christopher Timothy, Peter Davison and Robert Hardy

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Television arrives in the Dales, and Siegfried thinks he is the ideal candidate to treat a dog with a weak heart. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don takes his global tour to the US to investigate whether the worlds most powerful nation expresses its wealth through its beauty spots. In New York he meets a group of garden guerrillas transforming derelict land into community oases. In Virginia, he visits a conservation project that details Americas history, and in California he searches for plots that reflect the glamour of Hollywood

programme.title: Pavarotti Masterclass
programme.desc: A 1987 programme in which Italian stenor Luciano Pavarotti acts as coach to four young singers, giving them a short masterclass in the skills he has learnt from a life in opera

programme.title: Strauss: The Waltz King
programme.desc: A 2005 drama-documentary narrated by soprano Lesley Garrett, exploring composer Johann Strauss IIs music and looking at his turbulent family life. Despite success in his home town of Vienna and abroad, Strauss felt overshadowed by his father, who had originally popularised the waltz in the city. Simon Williams stars as Johann Strauss II, with Joe Duttine and Alexandra Gilbreath also among the cast

programme.title: Reputations
programme.sub-title: Dr Martin Luther King - Days of Hope
programme.desc: A 1997 profile of Martin Luther King Jr, immortalised as one of the great champions of civil rights and non-violent protest. Drawing on interviews with the people he knew, this film reveals that King was never comfortable with the praise he received and was often tormented by self-doubt

programme.title: Face to Face
programme.desc: A 1961 interview in which the civil rights activist talks to John Freeman about his childhood experiences and the incidents that led to the Montgomery bus boycott, events that shaped Kings life and led to him becoming a national figurehead and civil rights leader

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Bridging the Gap: How the Severn Bridge Was Built
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin marks the 50th anniversary of the construction of the Severn Bridge in a Timeshift special telling the inside story of its design and construction. As the motorway link between England and Wales, the Severn Bridge was described as the most perfect suspension bridge in the world, and Liz reveals how its unique, slim-line structure came about by accident

programme.title: Munro: Mountain Man
programme.desc: The story of Victorian adventurer Hugh Munro and his determination to list and climb all the Scottish mountains whose height exceeds 3,000ft. Nicholas Crane visits some of the countrys spectacular mountains as he explores the adventurers bid to reach more than 500 peaks and reveals how his name has been adopted by climbing enthusiasts pursuing the same goal, a pastime known as Munro bagging

programme.title: Strauss: The Waltz King
programme.desc: A 2005 drama-documentary narrated by soprano Lesley Garrett, exploring composer Johann Strauss IIs music and looking at his turbulent family life. Despite success in his home town of Vienna and abroad, Strauss felt overshadowed by his father, who had originally popularised the waltz in the city. Simon Williams stars as Johann Strauss II, with Joe Duttine and Alexandra Gilbreath also among the cast

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don takes his global tour to the US to investigate whether the worlds most powerful nation expresses its wealth through its beauty spots. In New York he meets a group of garden guerrillas transforming derelict land into community oases. In Virginia, he visits a conservation project that details Americas history, and in California he searches for plots that reflect the glamour of Hollywood

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Alex Jones is joined by chefs Bryn Williams, Andi Oliver and Ravneet Gill, and by special guest Ben Elton. Drinks expert Olly Smith picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits a deer farm near Bodmin Moor run by Pip and Matt Smith, before returning to the kitchen in Padstow to make a simple venison Wellington. Later, he spends an afternoon on Porthgwarra beach with the artist Hannah Woodman, whose work is inspired by the sea-worn landscape of west Cornwall, before defining the Cornish sense of humour over a pint with comedian Jonny Cowling

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Tommy Walsh sees the potential in a bungalow in the beautiful Norfolk Broads, while Dion Dublin is on familiar turf in both Stoke and Coventry with two intriguing projects

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents from Shepton Mallet, where she visits a museum with an historic collection of American quilts. Caroline Hawley and Thomas Forrester assist the teams

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph tries out a bold peacock design on a sideboard, but will her efforts leave her fanning out the cash?

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Ben and Shelleys new-build garden in Wing, Buckinghamshire, is sloped, impractical and has a tiny patio. Having travelled extensively across Europe, the couple yearn for a Mediterranean courtyard-style garden to remind them of their adventures abroad. It must also feature a childrens play zone for youngsters Eva and Maya. Siblings David and Harry Rich vie with Arit Anderson to help the pair transform this troublesome space

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: In south Wales, Nick Knowles and the team help Dan and Anna after an accident. Now a wheelchair user, Dan needs his home transformed to support his rehab and his goal to walk again

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse helps two Eurovision enthusiasts and their cat to find a new home in the Cumbrian countryside, and meets a young family of keen climbers and outdoor adventurers

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Celebrity Inner Circle
programme.desc: Lawrence Chaney, Hannah Cockroft, Rick Edwards, Darren Harriott, Sarah Parish and Fay Ripley take part in the quiz show in which contestants and their celebrity partners must outsmart each other to win a cash prize. Hosted by Amanda Holden

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman present movie week, in which the couples take to the dance floor to perform routines inspired by, or paying tribute to, Hollywood films. Adding to the theme, theres an appearance from Wicked star Cynthia Erivo, while judges Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke give their thoughts on the performances

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts a battle of the nations special, featuring two contestants from each of the UKs home countries. With Gordon Smart and Amy Macdonald representing Scotland, Paul Brand and Josie DArby playing for Wales, Stephen Mangan and Leomie Anderson for England, and Jamie-Lee ODonnell and Bronagh Waugh representing Northern Ireland

programme.title: Nine Bodies in a Mexican Morgue
programme.desc: The survivors work out how to call for help but are faced with a treacherous climb. As some of the group begin to crack under the pressure, a third death, the most violent so far, warns them that they are running out of time

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Afterlife
programme.desc: When a single mum and her two kids arrive in a small town, they begin to discover their connection to the original Ghostbusters and the secret legacy their grandfather Egon Spengler left behind. Supernatural comedy sequel, directed by Jason Reitman and starring Carrie Coon, Paul Rudd, Finn Wolfhard and Mckenna Grace, with cameo appearances by Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Ernie Hudson, Annie Potts and Sigourney Weaver

programme.title: Twisted Metal
programme.desc: John and Quiet find themselves caught in a trap. Agent Stone tests the loyalty of his new recruits

programme.title: Twisted Metal
programme.desc: John strikes a dangerous deal in order to get desperately needed supplies. Quiet questions her future

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Sunday Politics Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers looks at the political developments of the week and questions policy-makers on the key issues

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Mehreen Baig host the topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: Prayer and Reflection
programme.desc: A daily morning service from Guru Nanak Darbar Gurdwara Sikh temple in Gravesend, Kent, including the culmination of the Akhand Path, a 48-hour continuous prayer. Featuring a core element of Sikhism called Sewa, or selfless service, in which volunteer prepare food for the congregation throughout the course of the day

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine presents from Oswestry, Shropshire, and discovers a collection of miniature outfits tracing fashion over the last 1000 years. With Danny Sebastian and Colin Young

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.sub-title: Young Chorister of the Year - Final
programme.desc: Aled Jones and the Rev Kate Bottley host the final of BBC Young Chorister of the Year from Halle St Peters in Manchester, with judges Gareth Malone, Michelle John and Harry Bradford. As a finale, all the choristers from the junior and senior heats join Aled to sing How Great Thou Art by Stuart K Hine

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Wallace and Gromit in The Curse of the Were-Rabbit
programme.desc: Inventor Wallace and his canine sidekick Gromit have set up a pest-control service, and are called in to stop rabbits overrunning a garden show. However, the pair are overwhelmed when a destructive giant bunny arrives on the scene, while an interfering aristocrat contrives to make matters worse. Nick Parks Oscar-winning animated adventure, with the voices of Peter Sallis, Ralph Fiennes and Helena Bonham Carter

programme.title: Planet Earth Live
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury and wildlife expert Lynn Rogers explore the Northwoods of Minnesota, following three black bear cubs and learning the dangers they face in the wild. The infant creatures are desirable prey for roaming coyotes and wolves, and combined with the threat posed by hunters and changeable weather conditions, their survival depends entirely on how well they learn skills from their mother

programme.title: Dynasties
programme.sub-title: Macaque: Monkeys in the Mountains - A Dynasties Special
programme.desc: Cameras follow leadership struggles among Barbary macaque monkeys in the Atlas Mountains of Morocco. The troops new alpha has successfully led the monkeys for a year through a drought and a frozen winter, but an error of judgment places his position in jeopardy. As mating season approaches, his allies start to turn against him, and a brutal attack sees him deposed, and banished from the group. However, the new leader proves far more aggressive, giving his ousted predecessor a chance to seize his position back. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Adam Henson visit Herefordshire during the apple harvest, and discover the various kinds of cider production to be found in the county. Plus, Tom Heap is out at sea with scientists investigating the impact of Britains rapidly expanding offshore windfarms on marine life

programme.title: Hamzas Hidden Wild Isles
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Hamza Yassin reveals hidden wildlife gems from across the British Isles. In the spring, he encounters badgers, adders and nightingales. Hamza also heads to the Wirral to try and film one of the weirdest events in Britain. A high spring tide forces small mammals to leave their homes in the marsh and head to higher ground, providing a frenzy for a range of predators

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman present as the two lowest-scoring duos go head to head in the second dance-off of the series - and if the panel cannot decide who to put through, the casting vote will now be shared weekly among all the judges. Adding to the fun, pianist Lang Lang performs a Disney classic and the professionals transform viewers to the Minecraft world

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents from Tarvit Mansion and Garden in Fife, Scotland. Finds include a painting by Jack Vettriano, a silver statue of Prince Albert and a haul of gold sovereigns. Fionas antiques knowledge is put to the test by Ceramics expert Will Farmer when he challenges her to work out where in the world three different Art Deco antiques were created.

programme.title: Riot Women
programme.desc: Sally Wainwrights drama about five women who find an escape from their chaotic lives by forming a punk band for a local talent contest. One member of the group is brought back from the brink of suicide by the offer, while a police officer finds that her latest arrest might be just the missing ingredient the band needs. Starring Tamsin Greig, Joanna Scanlan, Amelia Bullmore, Rosalie Craig and Lorraine Ashbourne

programme.title: Blackmailed: The Sextortion Killers
programme.desc: Reporter Tir Dhondy investigates the rise of sextortion scams targeting teenage boys on social media, including the case of 16-year-old victim Evan Boettler. Her journey leads to Nigeria, where she confronts the scammers taking part in these crimes. With unprecedented access and interviews with industry insiders, Tir exposes a disturbing online underworld and its devastating consequences

programme.title: The Womens Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekends games in the Super League, including Chelsea v Tottenham Hotspur, Arsenal v Brighton and Hove Albion and Liverpool v Manchester City

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Julia Roberts talks about her latest role in psychological campus drama After the Hunt. Colin Farrell discusses playing a con man and gambling addict in atmospheric thriller Ballad of a Small Player. Singer Gloria Estefan introduces her new Spanish-language album Raices. And Benedict Cumberbatch talks about playing a newly widowed father in The Thing with Feathers. Plus, Robbie Williams performs Pretty Face from the forthcoming album BRITPOP

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Time Lord is trapped by an army of Weeping Angels, and his only chance of escape is to climb through the wreckage of the space liner that crashed into the temple. In the forest vault, Amy faces an even more deadly attack. Matt Smith and Karen Gillan are again joined by Alex Kingston as River Song

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The time travellers head off to 16th-century Venice, where not only is the city sealed off to protect residents from the plague, but they are also trapped with a coven of vampires. As the Doctor tries to deal with the threat, he crosses swords with Rosanna, the scheming head of the House of Calvierri. Helen McCrory and Lucian Msamati guest star alongside Matt Smith and Karen Gillan

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy about the romance between a couple with differing cultures and backgrounds. Gavin and Stacey have flirted for months on the phone at work but have never met up - until she travels from Wales to London to see him. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star alongside Rob Brydon, Alison Steadman, Ruth Jones and James Corden

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The couple have their first lovers tiff and Gavin is so beside himself with worry he drives all the way to Barry Island to resolve things. Stacey finally agrees to return to Billericay with her beau, prompting his proud mum Pamela to set about cleaning the house from top to bottom. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The queens take on a hyperpop banger for the Girl Group challenge. Girls Aloud star Nadine Coyle joins RuPaul, Michelle Visage and Graham Norton on the judging panel

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon as a British-Jamaican film-maker facing the day-to-day struggles of being an independent creative trying to survive in London. Kwabena searches for his first directing job, but only finds scripts built on tired black stereotypes. With time running out, he considers whether to take any job or hold out for integrity. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon, Dani Moseley and Demmy Ladipo

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabenas long-awaited break comes with Sin and Subterfuge, a radical colour-blind Regency drama. What at first feels like a dream project soon raises unsettling questions and Kwabena tries to find a solution. A spark with talented actress comes at the worst possible time when an old flame resurfaces. Meanwhile, Funmi and Maurice sharpen their airs and graces in a bid to secure Mayowa a place at the boroughs top nursery. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabenas first day on set finds him working with his hero, legendary actor Rudolph Williams. Determined to support the veteran performer, his good intentions are tested by the relentless demands of the shoot. To make matters worse, Vanessa weighs heavily on his mind, after their run-in brings up feelings he struggles to ignore. Maurice and Funmi are called in by the nursery after an altercation between Mayowa and another child, but are surprised to find things arent as they first assumed. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Donna inherits a house, but receives a strange warning never to open the cupboard under the stairs. Louise confides in a police psychotherapist and Jonny feels too scared to go outside after the shooting - so Janet resorts to starving him out

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon as a British-Jamaican film-maker facing the day-to-day struggles of being an independent creative trying to survive in London. Kwabena searches for his first directing job, but only finds scripts built on tired black stereotypes. With time running out, he considers whether to take any job or hold out for integrity. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon, Dani Moseley and Demmy Ladipo

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabenas long-awaited break comes with Sin and Subterfuge, a radical colour-blind Regency drama. What at first feels like a dream project soon raises unsettling questions and Kwabena tries to find a solution. A spark with talented actress comes at the worst possible time when an old flame resurfaces. Meanwhile, Funmi and Maurice sharpen their airs and graces in a bid to secure Mayowa a place at the boroughs top nursery. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabenas first day on set finds him working with his hero, legendary actor Rudolph Williams. To make matters worse, Vanessa weighs heavily on his mind, after their run-in brings up feelings he struggles to ignore. Maurice and Funmi are called in by the nursery after an altercation between Mayowa and another child, but are surprised to find things arent as they first assumed. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

His role as a father to baby Bambi brings both joy and pressure as he tries to convince Molly-Mae he is a changed man. After finally getting the medical all-clear to fight again, Tommy and his trainer and father John prepare for his return to the ring against MMA fighter Darren Till. Team Fury travels to the press conference - with John promising to be on his best behaviour

programme.desc: Zahra-Roses family is from Somalia, a country situated on the east coast of Africa. In Somalia, they have the traditional dish of nafaqo, which is boiled egg wrapped in mashed potato. This is what Zahra-Rose has chosen to make for her friends. To begin with, Zahra-Rose seasons mashed potato with salt, black pepper, flour, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder and fresh coriander. She then wraps the potato mixture around her special ingredient, hard-boiled eggs, rolls them in breadcrumbs and puts them in the oven to be cooked. Zahra-Rose also serves a fresh chilli sauce, so her friends can use it for dipping. Not only does Zahra-Rose have beautiful decorations, she also has a surprise picnic planned. Will her friends realise what her special ingredient is?

programme.desc: Elder Panda is teaching Love Monster to fly a kite. Love Monster loves to watch it swish around in the air. Elder Panda goes off to get some froyo, which is perfect on Kite Day. Before he goes, he tells Love Monster that soon it will be time for him to go on to his next kiting challenge. Love Monster looks at all the other kites and sees the dragon kite, which is the largest kite of them all. Love Monsters small kite doesnt seem that exciting any more. He decides to try the dragon kite for just a minute. At first it seems easy, but then a wind gets it tangled in a tree. The rope breaks, and the kite flies off, causing mayhem in Fluffytown with everyone thinking it is a real dragon invasion. Finally, Elder Panda arrives and manages to bring it down to the ground using an umbrella, and Love Monster comes clean, saying how sorry he is. programme.desc: Emilios family are from Cyprus, an island nation in the Mediterranean Sea. Emilio is making two Cypriot recipes for his friends to enjoy. The first is pitta bread! programme.desc: A poverty-stricken squire spies an opportunity to make his dreams come true when his employer dies. He takes his place as a knight, launching himself on the road to riches by competing in jousting tournaments, but his ruse is jeopardised by a dastardly nobleman. Comedy adventure, starring Heath Ledger, Paul Bettany, Mark Addy, Shannyn Sossamon and Rufus Sewell

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit successful buyers from seasons past. In 2017 mother and daughter Linda and Laura bought a flat in Bristol with Phils help that would suit Laura and her partner until they found their own home and Linda would move in with her husband when they retired. In 2018 Ranald and Marjorie were looking for a bigger home to hold family get-togethers with enough bedrooms for all the grandkids. Now Kirstie and Phil are back to see if the properties they bought were everything they hoped for

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in Chippenham to help Tim and Sonia decide whether to sell or renovate their home. Eight years ago, the couple moved into Tims childhood home to take care of his elderly mother. Nowshe has died, Tim and daughter Ella are ready to move on to a fresh start in a new home, but Sonia thinks with a little work they can start their new chapter without having to move

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to West Sussex to meet with Olaf and Fritha who, in 2019, set out to build their own oasis on a piece of land that is boxed in by a railway line and an A-road. Due to an underground mains sewer, they were unable to build on half their plot and were left with a small triangle on which to build a three-bedroom house. They began with only £190,000 and were immediately surprised at the price of the sturdy retaining walls and foundations they needed to combat traffic vibrations and the sharp, pointed angles of the hand-built timber frame stretched Olaf to his limits. Kevin returns to see how life has gone for the pair and their new young daughter Lagertha in their triangular house

programme.title: Channel 4 News

programme.title: Bettany Hughes Treasures of the World
programme.desc: Bettany lifts the lid on the most remarkable treasures of civilisation to investigate the story of humanity. In this episode, she heads for Croatia where she begins her journey on the island of Korcula, diving with archaeologists to uncover a Neolithic settlement that offers a glimpse into early coastal life. On the mainland, Bettany explores Diocletians Palace in Split, discovering how the fortress became the heart of the Eastern Roman Empire

programme.title: Great British Train Journeys from Above
programme.desc: Hugh Bonneville narrates the most iconic steam train journeys in Britain. The first episode tracks the Jacobite Railway, which runs through the Scottish Highlands from Fort William to Mallaig. The programme visits the site of Bonnie Prince Charlies hideout, and explores the history of the Jacobite Rebellion

programme.title: The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent

Ford Motors are hoping to revive their flagging fortunes by launching a racing division and securing a high-profile win at the prestigious Le Mans 24-hour race. Shelby takes up the challenge of headlining the plan to build a revolutionary new race car, but courts conflict within the company by recruiting unpredictable, short-tempered British driver Ken Miles to take the wheel. programme.desc: A profile of the singer and actress as she turns 90, celebrating a career that has spanned more than eight decades, from child prodigy to global superstar. programme.title: Clarence House: The Kings Private Home
programme.desc: A look at the home of King Charles and Queen Camilla, a stately Georgian mansion on the Mall in the City of Westminster. Tucked away from the tourist trail, Clarence House is somewhere the royals have always been free to be themselves - to fall in love, to celebrate, to argue, and to mourn. Royal historians, journalists and biographers divulge the stories of this residence, and the VIPs who have called it home

programme.title: Princess Anne: The Power Behind the Throne
programme.desc: A look at the Princess Royals role in the royal family, revealing how she has blazed a trail throughout her life, while quietly redefining what it means to serve. Alongside her duties and raising a family, Princess Anne continues to support charities close to her heart and in the process has notched up another groundbreaking first, receiving a nomination for the Nobel Peace Prize. Featuring colourful archive, including TV appearances on Wogan, Question of Sport and Parkinson

programme.title: Harry and Meghan: Royal Hypocrites?
programme.desc: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have been plagued by allegations of hypocrisy and double standards, demanding their privacy then chasing the spotlight. They asked to leave the royal family, then continued to trade on their royal credentials. Are they victims of press persecution, or are these allegations fair? This documentary investigates the long list of contradictions at the heart of Prince Harry and his wifes post-royal life, featuring analysis, insider testimonies and a deep dive into the couples evolving brand. The programme explores whether their actions align with their stated values, looking at the headlines, the deals and the drama

It begins with his early years, when he is driven by the desire to prove himself to his father. He is born into aristocracy in the grand family home of Bleinhem Palace. From a young age he is acutely aware he has a lot to live up to. His father, Randolph Churchill, is an ambitious, controversial, highly successful politician and a strict disciplinarian who fails to give young Winston the affection he craves. Churchill never gets the chance to reconcile with his father and channels his sense of loss at his untimely death into a fierce determination to succeed at all costs

She then boards the impressive vessel that will take her down the River Douro. The cruise delivers her to the architectural wonder of Lamego, Vila Real and the home of Mateus Rose. She even manages to hop over the border to Spain to visit the city of Salamanca. There is plenty of food, drink and local culture on offer on Janes luxurious cruise, which ends its journey in the capital city of Lisbon

programme.desc: New York Jets v Denver Broncos (Kick-off 2.30pm). Nat Coombs presents coverage of the week six match from Tottenham Hotspur Stadium in London, as the second of three games to be played in the UK this season takes place. The Jets also played here last season as the designated visiting team when falling to a 23-17 loss to the Minnesota Vikings, while the Broncos have never featured here but have recorded one win and one loss in previous appearances at Wembley Stadium, the most recent being a 21-17 triumph over the Jacksonville Jaguars in 2022. programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe learns Joeys agent has died, but he is so upset about his friends moving away that she decides not to tell him. Meanwhile, Monica supervises the packing for a new life in the suburbs with Chandler, while also keeping a close eye on the mother of their future adopted child

programme.title: Friends

programme.title: Michael McIntyres Big Show

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride

A confession from Malcolm about what he gets up to while Jude is at the bingo leaves her fuming, and Elisas revelation about a celebrity crush leaves her boyfriend Alan speechless. Finally, its the turn of Sabbi and Ashley to host with an Indo-Caribbean fusion they think is destined to win them the £1,000

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Web designer Danny and his wife, compliance manager Holly, kick off the week in Northampton with a Tex Mex menu. However, when Chris waxes lyrical about their motorhome, their guests long for him to finish. On the final night, Georgia and Ollie pull out all the stops with a posh pub grub menu and hope to add some class to proceedings, but Georgia having upset Chris and Hilary at their place means the knives are out

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Florida to help the owners of Fleming, a Danish restaurant in Miami. With a Cuban chef cooking Nordic cuisine and a filthy kitchen, things go from bad to worse until it all comes to a head on relaunch night

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA

Can Gordon turn things around and help repair the relationship between mother and daughter in the process?

Throughout it all, Greg Davies expertly maintains order with his usual stern authority. They talk about everything, from the bride that thinks she might be too much for her groom, the couple that felt an instant spark, and the other trying to form a deeper connection. Also, newly-wed bride April shares details about her wedding and how she felt about becoming Mrs Hotdog

programme.title: Virgin Island
programme.desc: In a workshop, the group members are asked to strip off and face themselves in the mirror. The session proves too much for Louise, who reveals painful issues from her past, and encourages Charlotte to reveal her weight-loss surgery. Zac tries to impress the girls by dishing out compliments. Meanwhile, accountant Dave turns from sceptic to highflyer as he takes on a series of sexual firsts with surrogate-partner therapist Kat

programme.title: Monster Hunter
programme.desc: When Cpt Artemis and her loyal soldiers are transported to a new world, they engage in a desperate battle for survival against enormous enemies with incredible powers. Fantasy adventure based on the video game, starring Milla Jovovich, Tony Jaa and Ron Perlman

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The final newlyweds embark on their honeymoons, and while one couple realise that physical intimacy doesnt always lead to a deeper connection, another pair are pushed to breaking point by one partners constant need for reassurance. Also, a brides family deliver stern words of warning to her badly behaved husband

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in New Jersey to help Rose Leone, who spent two years in a coma and came out of hospital to learn her son Michael had run her once-thriving Italian restaurant into the ground. With a menu of more than 126 dishes, the quality of the food is suffering, and even the chefs refuse to eat their own creations

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The day of Franks 1920s-themed wedding arrives and Phil asks the Dunphys to get into the spirit by wearing costumes, while Cam gets a surprise when he finally stands up to Pam

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Gloria, Claire, Haley, Alex, Lily, Luke and Manny find different ways to show support for the womens movement, while a car park causes a major disagreement between Jay and Phil

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Tensions rise in Graces family, and a row erupts between sisters, Tom and Peri rekindle their teenage romance, and a resident plots revenge. Meanwhile, the village holds a vigil for the serial killers victims, and Cleo visits Joel in prison. A hurting mother admits her true feelings, a resident receives some unexpected flattery, and a proposal is interrupted by a shock announcement. Lucas and Dillon are at loggerheads, and a resident receives an ultimatum

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The naturalist investigates whether animals and plants have developed an awareness of mathematics, including bamboos that flower exactly the same around the world. Plus, the story of a German horse named Hans that was declared a mathematical genius, but all was not as it seemed

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist investigates two shells that have proved to be winners in evolution - the birds egg shell and the hard shell of the tortoise. The ostrich egg is so strong it is possible for it to take a persons weight without breaking - so how does a chick manage break out of such a fortress? The evolution of the tortoise shell was for a long time a mystery, and this bony box offers a lot more than just protection

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The evolutionary documentary concludes, as David Attenborough profiles the Siamese fighting fish, so aggressive it will fight its own reflection until it is exhausted. He also looks at the kangaroo - once pitted against humans in the boxing ring - which has a kick so strong it can kill

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores natures evolutionary anomalies and examines two creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world. The chameleon has an extra-long tongue that helps it catch prey and the giraffes neck is so long it is easily able to reach the tops of trees for food

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough highlights the curiosities that have led to accusations of forgery, but have ultimately helped assist the rethinking of evolution. When early explorers brought the first specimen of a duck-billed platypus to England in 1799, it was considered so bizarre it was deemed a hoax. Similarly, the midwife toad became the centre of a scientific storm in the 1920s that led to accusations of fakery

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough encounters two species with wrinkly skin, where nature has tinkered with the ageing process to different effect. The mole rat retains its looks while growing old and the elephant looks old from birth, yet both creatures live relatively long lives

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attend questions why spirals are so widespread in nature. He gleans some answers by examining the narwhals tusk and the spiral shells found on snails and ammonites, as he continues to discover natures evolutionary anomalies

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines a zebras stripes and the wings of a butterfly, as he continues to discover natures evolutionary anomalies

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: Save the Last Dance for Me
programme.desc: An escaped convict arrives in Sun Hill to settle an old score with his ex-girlfriend

programme.title: Dragonball Evolution
programme.desc: An ordinary teenager is recruited by a mystical martial arts master for a vitally important quest. He must find seven magical spheres before they fall into the hands of an evil warlord, who intends to use their power to let him take over the world. Fantasy adventure based on the Japanese cartoon series, starring Justin Chatwin, Chow Yun-Fat and James Marsters

programme.title: Babys Day Out
programme.desc: Three bungling kidnappers hatch a plan to pose as society reporters and snatch the baby son of a wealthy couple. However, the infant escapes on to the streets of New York, evading the crooks every attempt to recapture him. Comedy, starring Joe Mantegna, Lara Flynn Boyle, Joe Pantoliano and Brian Haley

programme.title: The Seeker: The Dark Is Rising
programme.desc: A teenager discovers he is the last in a long line of warriors destined to defend the world from dark forces. His duty now is to embark on a perilous journey through time to recover the six parts of a powerful mystical artefact and ensure it is returned to safe hands. Fantasy adventure, starring Alexander Ludwig, Christopher Eccleston and Ian McShane

programme.title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
programme.desc: After being bitten by a radioactive arachnid, student Miles Morales develops incredible abilities, and becomes a version of Spider-Man. When a super collider device opens a gateway to other dimensions, Miles crosses paths with five counterparts to stop a threat for all realities. Oscar-winning animated adventure, with the voices of Shameik Moore and Nicolas Cage

programme.title: Gemini Man
programme.desc: An ageing assassin is targeted by a mysterious young operative that seems able to anticipate his every move. Discovering that hes being hunted by a younger clone of himself, Henry needs to find out why hes being targeted and who the creator is. Action drama, starring Will Smith, Mary Elizabeth Winstead and Clive Owen

Space age pilot Mills suffers a catastrophic mechanical failure at the controls of his craft and crash-lands on a mysterious planet. Armed with limited munitions, he deduces that he is stranded on Earth 65 million years ago when dinosaurs ruled the third rock from the sun. Action adventure, starring Adam Driver and Ariana Greenblatt

programme.title: The Black Phone
programme.desc: In 1970s North Denver, a masked predator nicknamed The Grabber poses as a magician to lure unsuspecting children into the back of his van. Five youngsters vanish without trace despite the best efforts of Detectives Wright and Miller to identify a prime suspect. Their enquiries lead to Gwen Shaw, an abused girl who claims to have prophetic dreams about the missing boys. Horror, starring Mason Thames, Ethan Hawke, Madeleine McGraw and Jeremy Davies

programme.title: The Lovely Bones
programme.desc: A 14-year-old girl is murdered by her neighbour and finds herself in an afterlife drawn from her own subconscious. She watches over her family, as her parents struggle to cope in the face of their loss and her sister seeks to identify the killer - who, having covered his tracks, is preparing to strike again. Peter Jacksons fantasy drama, starring Saoirse Ronan, Rachel Weisz, Mark Wahlberg, Stanley Tucci and Susan Sarandon

programme.title: Barnacle Bill
programme.desc: The latest in a long line of seafarers tries to save a derelict Victorian pier from demolition by getting it registered as a vessel. Ealing comedy, starring Alec Guinness, Irene Browne, Maurice Denham and Lionel Jeffries

programme.title: The Borrowers
programme.desc: A family of four-inch-high people living beneath the floorboards of an ordinary human home help the owners son fight back when a dastardly lawyer plans to demolish the house and make way for a luxury apartment block. Childrens fantasy, starring John Goodman, Jim Broadbent, Celia Imrie, Flora Newbigin and Tom Felton

programme.title: Tooth Fairy
programme.desc: A minor-league ice hockey player is nicknamed the Tooth Fairy for knocking opponents teeth out on the ice. When the cynical athlete discourages a young fan, he is forced to pay penance by spending a week as the real Tooth Fairy, rediscovering his dreams in the process. Family comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Ashley Judd, Stephen Merchant, Ryan Sheckler and Seth MacFarlane

programme.title: Bridge of Spies Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about the making of the Cold War espionage drama

programme.title: Turner and Hooch
programme.desc: A Californian detective investigating the murder of a local man by drug smugglers has only one witness to help him solve the case - the large, smelly dog that belonged to the victim, which is about to turn the detectives well-ordered existence into chaos. Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson

programme.title: Bumblebee
programme.desc: In 1987, lonely Californian teenager Charlie Watson is traumatised by the death of her father and resentful of her mother Sallys relationship with new boyfriend Ronald. For her 18th-birthday shes given a yellow Volkswagen Beetle, which turns out to be the battle-scarred Autobot Bumblebee. Transformers prequel, starring Hailee Steinfeld, John Cena and Jorge Lendeborg Jr

programme.title: Top Gun: Maverick
programme.desc: Pete Maverick Mitchell returns to the Top Gun Instructor programme, where he must confront his past as he trains a group of younger pilots for a deadly mission. Among them is the son of Mavericks deceased best friend, Lieutenant Nick Goose Bradshaw. Director Joseph Kosinskis Oscar-winning action drama, starring Tom Cruise, Jennifer Connelly, Miles Teller, Val Kilmer, Bashir Salahuddin and Glen Powell

programme.title: Infinite
programme.desc: A man who finds himself troubled by memories that are not his and developing skills he never learned is recruited by a mysterious organisation. The members of this group have learned to access the experiences of their past lives, but one has gone rogue, and must be stopped in his efforts to end the cycle of reincarnation by destroying all human life. Sci-fi thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Paranormal Activity: Next of Kin
programme.desc: Margot, a young woman who was abandoned by her mother as a baby, travels to a secluded Amish community with a documentary film crew seeking answers about her mother and extended family. Horror thriller, starring Emily Bader, Roland Buck III and Dan Lippert

programme.title: Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: A spaceship crash-lands on a mysterious planet where humans are mute creatures who find themselves at the mercy of intelligent apes. The worlds simian rulers are horrified when one of the crew reveals he can speak and plan to have him killed, but two chimpanzee scientists intervene, determined to learn from the new arrival. Sci-fi drama, starring Charlton Heston, Roddy McDowall, Kim Hunter and Maurice Evans

programme.title: The Alamo
programme.desc: As a 7,000-strong Mexican army sweeps across Texas, Colonel William Travis is given the task of drawing the invading forces with a desperate last stand using a small force of volunteers at the Alamo Mission in San Antonio, giving his superior officers time to assemble their counter-attack. Western based on the historical battle, directed by and starring John Wayne. With Richard Widmark and Laurence Harvey

Drama, starring Steve McQueen, James Coburn, Donald Pleasence, James Garner, Charles Bronson and Richard Attenborough

programme.title: The Sweetest Christmas
programme.desc: Kylie, a struggling pastry chef, discovers she has secured a place in the finals of the American Gingerbread Competition. Spotting a chance to raise her profile - and perhaps jumpstart business at her new cafe - she enters, but her chances of winning are quickly slashed when her oven breaks down right before the contest. Determined to remain in the running, she appeals to her old boyfriend Nick, who gave up his education to take over his family pizzeria. He agrees to let her use his kitchens industrial ovens to craft her gingerbread delicacies, and as they pair work together, a familiar spark rekindles their old flame. Festive romance, starring Lacey Chabert and Lea Coco

programme.desc: Jack returns to duty after a period of suspension, and finds himself investigating the murder of a man who had been leading a double life. In addition, he also has to deal with the baffling case of a man found dead with his right foot hacked off and replaced by a severed left foot. Drama, starring David Jason and Amanda Root

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The news of Martins Imperial College job offer goes flying through the village, but the Ellinghams are yet to make a decision. Caitlin blames Bert for the flooded pub cellar, and an emergency on the rocks helps Morwenna make some important decisions

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The discovery of a body at a ramshackle farm alerts Wycliffe to the fact that a murderer is at large in a sleepy Cornish village - and when two locals disappear, he realises it will take all his deductive powers to solve the mystery. Whodunit, starring Jack Shepherd and Helen Masters

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: A young woman asks Poirot to investigate her fathers murder - a 14-year-old crime for which her mother was found guilty and executed. The detective agrees to investigate, but warns his client that he may discover things she does not want to hear. David Suchet stars, with Rachael Stirling, Aidan Gillen, Aimee Mullens, Toby Stephens, Gemma Jones, Patrick Malahide and Annette Badland

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: The detective investigates a double poisoning, aiming to prove the innocence of Elinor Carlisle, the chief suspect in the deaths of her aunt and her rival in love. However, it emerges that she is the only person with a motive, opportunity and means to administer the poison. Crime drama, starring David Suchet, Elisabeth Dermot-Walsh, Diana Quick, Paul McGann and Rupert Penry-Jones

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: The dapper Belgian sleuth goes on an Egyptian cruise on board an old steamer, but when an American heiress is murdered, his little grey cells go into overdrive. On questioning each of his fellow passengers, he realises many of them have secrets they want to remain hidden. David Suchet stars, with James Fox, Judy Parfitt, Emily Blunt, Daisy Donovan, Frances de la Tour and David Soul

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: A philandering husband is found dying by the swimming pool after being shot during a house party at the home of Lady Lucy Angkatell. Legendary Belgian Sleuth Poirot, who is guest of honour at the gathering, appears to have an open-and-shut case on his hands - but the investigator finds himself up against one of his finest adversaries. Whodunit, guest-starring Sarah Miles (Ryans Daughter), with David Suchet, Lysette Anthony and Edward Fox

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Each year, the Midsomer village of Angels Rise hosts an annual psychic fayre in the vast and gothic Eddon Hall. Founded by the Saint-Stephens family in memory of their late daughter, the event attracts all manner of mediums, psychics and followers of the occult. When a body is found surrounded by ritual symbols on the eve of the gathering, Barnaby must step into a world of self-proclaimed witches to find the killer. Crime drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, with Tracy-Ann Oberman and Colin Salmon

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A body is found buried on the Northumberland moors which could be a missing teenager from the nearby rural community of Brindale. The girl had disappeared six weeks previously, and Vera has to break the news to her devastated family. However, the realisation that she died so close to home rather than at a music festival as originally thought creates tension among her neighbours, who are soon suspecting each other of murder. The detective delves into the vulnerable young womans isolated existence to identify her killer

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Blue Train
programme.desc: The sleuth finds himself in interesting company as English socialites and American millionaires rub shoulders on board a train bound for the French Riviera. Passengers include oil magnate Rufus Van Aldin (Elliott Gould) and his daughter Ruth (Jaime Murray) - to whom he has given a magnificent ruby known as the Heart of Fire. With members of the aristocracy crammed into a confined space with their husbands, lovers and a renowned gemstone, murder cannot be far away. With Lindsay Duncan, Roger Lloyd Pack and James DArcy

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell meet Sara Hathaway who, after losing her adoptive mother and older brother in the space of just a year, is desperate to find her birth family. Plus, Diane Kerridge shares her story of being forced to give up the child she gave birth to as a teenager in the 1960s. Over 50 years later, she is hoping to find her long lost son

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective and his team embark on a race against time to recapture a dangerous convict who has escaped from Bodmin prison - a case that leads them to an elaborate drugs racket. Starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters, Jimmy Yuill and Sean Chapman

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspected kidnapping and gets his first lead when a ransom note is discovered. The missing woman then turns up dead at the wheel of a crashed car, smelling of alcohol. Whodunit, starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective applies his professional know-how to a fatal shooting, and soon begins to suspect that the dead mans brother-in-law may know more about the case than he is letting on - a theory borne out by forensic tests on the murder weapon. Jack Shepherd stars as the dour detective, with Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Ethels flirting with Major Bryant lands her in trouble as preparations get under way for a concert at Downton. Tensions flare between Isobel and Cora, Edith receives worrying news about Matthew and William, while Branson declares his feelings for Sybil. Mrs Birds soup kitchen receives a helping hand from Daisy and Mrs Patmore. Costume drama, starring Penelope Wilton and Elizabeth McGovern

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The entire household is shaken by bad news from the front, and Daisys relationship with William moves faster than she would like. Meanwhile, Mary pays a high price for obtaining Carlisles assistance when Vera returns to Downton threatening to expose old secrets. Costume drama, starring Sophie McShera, Thomas Howes, Michelle Dockery, Iain Glen and Maria Doyle Kennedy

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: A Canadian officer is brought to Downton for recuperation and disrupts everything. Ethel hears distressing news, Bates makes another attempt to settle matters with Vera, while Carson receives a tempting offer. Matthew gets used to life in a wheelchair with Mary as his round-the-clock carer. Costume drama, starring Amy Nuttall, Brendan Coyle, Jim Carter, Dan Stevens and Michelle Dockery

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: As the residents try to return to normal life following the armistice, a new development stuns them. Meanwhile, Carlisle puts Anna in a difficult position, Bates reels from the news about Vera, and Thomas embarks on a new money-making scheme. Costume drama, starring Iain Glen, Joanne Froggatt, Brendan Coyle and Rob James-Collier

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The wedding approaches and excitement is in the air, but Bransons plans could rattle everyone. Spanish flu reaches the house and a desperate Thomas looks for a way to re-establish himself. Ethel faces a dilemma when the Bryants return with a heartbreaking proposition, and a decisive Anna forces Bates to think about their future. Costume drama, starring Allen Leech, Rob James-Collier, Amy Nuttall, Joanne Froggatt and Brendan Coyle

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth is called to Gossington Hall by her old friend Dolly Bantry (Joanna Lumley) when she finds the corpse of an unknown blonde in the library of her home. It soon transpires that there is no shortage of suspects, including local bad boy Basil Blake (Ben Miller) and Dollys husband Arthur (James Fox), but when the victim is identified as a dancer in line to inherit a fortune, enquiries take a different turn. Crime drama, starring Geraldine McEwan, with Simon Callow, Jack Davenport and Tara Fitzgerald

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The villagers throw the Ellinghams a farewell party and Ruth helps Mrs Tishell deal with the news and encourages her to attend, but it seems that Martin and Louisa arent going to make it because a farmer has spotted their lost dog. Final regular episode of the long-running drama series.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The unorthodox but brilliant North East detective investigates when charred human remains are found in an abattoir furnace, and attempts to deduce how and why they got there in the first place. The bones are identified as belonging to a fellow cop, leading Vera to uncover a web of dark secrets as she looks into her dead colleagues fraud squad. Brenda Blethyn dons her familiar hat and mac to play Vera in this mystery, based on the characters created by Ann Cleeves

programme.title: Coldwater
programme.desc: Fiona reconsiders her marriage when unsettling truths come to light, while John steels himself to face the consequences for his actions. News of another death in Coldwater throws everything into doubt for him as the mood in the village grows fraugh, with suspicion increasingly falling on John. At a prayer meeting meant to foster healing, a frightening attack by masked assailants leaves John and Fiona feeling increasingly isolated

programme.title: Coldwater

programme.title: Tales of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: The heroes in a half shell come to terms with their new roles as saviours of New York City in an animated series set shortly after the events chronicled in the film Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem. Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. Meanwhile, pampered rich kid Rod (Pete Davison) yearns to be a mutant and leverages his wealth and connections to achieve a dangerous dream

Along the way, Charlie hunts for the Loch Ness monster, and Christina dares to step on to the edge of the iconic Forth rail bridge

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Charlie Ross begin day two of their antique-finding road trip through Scotland, where they meet the penguins of Edinburgh Zoo and step on the top of the Forth Rail Bridge

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Charlie Ross travel through the north-east of England on day three of their antiques-finding road trip, and Charlie is feeling positive about his chances in the salesroom

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Christina Trevanion and Charlie Ross begin their day in York, before heading to their auction in Bourne, Lincolnshire. Charlie learns more about an invention that changed British roads for ever, and Christina discovers the history of the 400-year-old hand of a Catholic saint

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Christina Trevanion and Charlie Ross begin the final day of their road trip in the town of Spalding, Lincolnshire, before heading to Boston and battling it out at the final auction to see who can make the most profit

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi headss to the Dukes in the Bedfordshire village of Heath and Reach to help mum-of-two Sarah to improve the pub she bought three years ago. After a successful first year, a personal setback turned Sarahs dream into a nightmare. With a knock to her confidence and her eye off the ball, occupancy took a nosedive and the business has bombed. Alex arrives to find Sarah hiding from customers in the kitchen, staff kicking their heels and the place looking more like a youth club than a character country pub

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Berkshire beckons as Alex Polizzi is called to the Grenfell Arms in Maidenhead, a pub with eight bedrooms and a restaurant, all run by 31-year-old Jamie. He cannot find staff, so he is doing all the jobs with the help of his mum, Sandy. She brings a lot of experience and advice to the table, but the two have trouble working harmoniously together, which isnt helping Jamies business succeed

programme.title: Cornwall Air 999
programme.desc: The flying paramedics tend to a gardener in trouble and a patient with a unique medical history. They are also faced with a worrying head injury

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Nick Clare and his daughter Vicky deliver a fragile violin, hoping stringed instrument expert Becky Loughton can restore harmony to this treasured keepsake. Steve Fletchers mechanical know-how is called upon when Jane Griffin arrives with a 1930s mini replica cooker, a gift from her god mother. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Stained glass expert Matthew Nickels pieces together a damaged glass picture window depicting a colourful boat at sea. Made by the owners late father, it has a great deal of sentimental value. Meanwhile, leather expert Suzie Fletcher turns her attention to three iconic leather sling back Les Arcs chairs desperately in need of some love and attention to make them usable again. Plus, Steve Fletcher brings a German-made toy steam roller from the 1930s back to life

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Experts restore a tarnished rugby trophy, a hand-operated Victorian sewing machine, and a 1930s accordion, which has 64 individual components in need of repair

programme.title: Help! My House Is Haunted
programme.desc: Sandy Lakdar, Barri Ghai and Chris Fleming visit Wales oldest drinking establishment, which has a dark and turbulent history

programme.title: Help! My House Is Haunted
programme.desc: Sandy Lakdar, Barri Ghai and Chris Fleming explore a Scottish castle with a history of murder, torture and war, and which is supposedly haunted by a mysterious green lady

programme.title: My Dream Derelict Home in the Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas meets East Sussex couple Catherine and Dale as they rescue a derelict religious chapel and hermitage in Catalonia to create a dream family home

programme.title: My Dream Derelict Home in the Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas meets Norfolk couple Mark and Barbara as they renovate a dilapidated manor house in central France to create a home and BandB business

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Richard Osman delves into his Brighton roots and is astonished to discover how his four-times great grandfather turned amateur sleuth and ended up entangled in one of the citys most notorious murder trials. The quiz show presenter, TV producer and crime writer also investigates his grandfathers army career and learns why it gave him a profound belief in the power of education, which he passed on to his grandson

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Comedian, presenter and actor Matt Lucas had an exceptionally close bond with his late grandmother, Margot, who came to the UK in 1939 as a Jewish refugee from Nazi Germany. Matt has never fully understood what Margot experienced as a young woman in Berlin in the lead up to the Second World War - or what became of the extended family she left behind. Matts poignant journey takes him to Berlin, and then to Amsterdam where he discovers an extraordinary connection to Anne Frank, as well as the fate of his many family members who had fled to Holland, which was later was invaded by the Germans

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell return to help more people reunite with long-lost relatives, beginning with a man whose last contact with his father was a brief phone call from America when he was six, and a woman who was transported from Bogota to Berkshire when her Colombian birth mother gave her up for adoption

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps semi-retired builder Martyn and prison manager Sharon find their dream holiday home on Portugals Algarve. On their budget of £160,000, theyre looking for a year-round holiday home that all their friends and family can enjoy. Danni shows them five options, but will they love any of them enough to make an offer?

programme.title: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Rob Rinder head to the snowy Alps and the little-known Hotel Hubertus - a resort in the Tyrol region of northern Italy thats the vision of one family. Their hotel gives spectacular views of the mountains due to its creative architecture that features dramatic angles and levitating pools and saunas. The Gasser family run this hotel and also have links to the world-class ski resort above it - all bringing valuable income into the community. Rob and Monica work behind the scenes in the unique Heaven and Hell spa, cleaning the suspended pool, lead mountain treks and get to know the family behind the vision

programme.title: Grand Designs: House of the Year
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud, Damion Burrows and Michelle Ogundehin visit five properties that solve problems, including a modernist riverside house designed to withstand extreme floods, a modular timber home that elegantly resolves the challenges of building in a remote environment and a house that deploys discreet camouflage to blend into its overlooked setting. The others are a pared-back barn conversion that neatly sidesteps the pitfalls of restoring agricultural buildings and a Japanese-inspired house that proves a standard budget need not be an obstacle to building a bespoke home

programme.title: Scotlands Home of the Year
programme.desc: Judges Anna Campbell-Jones, Michael Angus and Kate Spiers check head to the East of Scotland to check out properties in Aberdeenshire and St Andrews, including a rural farm steading conversion, a silvery city apartment, and a home with a garden at its heart

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels along the eastern coast of Australia from the coal mines of Newcastle, New South Wales, to Queenslands modern state capital, Brisbane. In the worlds largest coal-exporting port, Michael marvels at the skill of the loader as he transfers thousands of tons of coal from rail to ship. He visits the Koala Hospital at Port Macquarie, where he finds populations of these marsupials are in rapid decline. Michael also visits a factory where the quintessential Australian bush hat is made and in Woolgoolga, he joins a Sikh community to hear how they have integrated into Australian society

programme.title: UCL Magazine Show

programme.title: Planet Earth III
programme.desc: The wildlife inhabiting the worlds oceans, from the shallow seas of the tropics, where predators like the lionfish can become the prey to one of the worlds oddest hunters, to the greatest depths, where a massive siphonophore, longer than a blue whale, and a gulper eel with huge jaws are captured on film using specialised vessels designed to withstand the pressure. The episode also features the mating dances of mobula rays and the symbiotic relationship between Columbus crabs and turtles

programme.title: European Qualifier for FIFA World Cup
programme.desc: Portugal v Republic of Ireland (Kick-off 7.45pm). Peter Collins is joined by Didi Hamann and Shay Given to present all the action from the Group F match at Estádio Jose Alvalade in Lisbon. The Republic have made a disappointing start to their campaign, drawing at home to Hungary before losing 2-1 away to Armenia, and how face a tough test against the group favourites, who won both of their opening contests. The sides last met in a friendly last year, when Portugal claimed a 3-0 win in Aveiro thanks to a goal by Joao Felix and a Cristiano Ronaldo brace. Commentary comes from Des Curran and Ray Houghton

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Afterlife
programme.desc: When a single mum and her two kids arrive in a small town, they begin to discover their connection to the original Ghostbusters and the secret legacy their grandfather Egon Spengler left behind. Supernatural comedy sequel, directed by Jason Reitman and starring Carrie Coon, Paul Rudd, Finn Wolfhard and Mckenna Grace, with cameo appearances by Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Ernie Hudson, Annie Potts and Sigourney Weaver

programme.title: Heat
programme.desc: The truth behind Toms injury is revealed, and Brads hopes with Mia are explored. Kip confesses to Tom he is growing marijuana in the shed. At rock bottom, Steve notices smoke on the horizon, concerned they really are in danger despite Brad insisting they arent. Drama, starring Danny Dyer

programme.title: Making

programme.desc: When the Colemans inherit a run-down beach house on a tropical island, 16-year-old Lucy convinces her father, Charlie, to fix the place up. In the process they discover a part of their late wife and mothers life neither knew anything about. Its not long before a shady lawyer arrives on the island and tries to convince Charlie to sell the property. Family drama, starring Anthony Coleman and Reegan Finkel

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Lexie makes a disturbing discovery about Hector while ploughing her way through Glenbogles accounts. Archie has trouble adjusting to life without Golly, but when a mystery man rescues a youngster lost in the wildlife park, he and Duncan realise fate has given them a vital clue to the gamekeepers whereabouts

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie faces losing the estate as he struggles to find a way to pay off Hectors death duties, and Greg capitalises on the situation by offering to buy the property - but just when all seems lost an affluent traveller offers a solution to the predicament. Meanwhile, Irenes secret past threatens to destroy her relationship with Duncan

programme.title: Wild West: Americas Great Frontier
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the history and geography of Americas deserts, canyons and wilderness, exploring the lives of the people and animals that have found ways to thrive and prosper in these brutally inhospitable conditions. The first programme examines the agricultural traditions of the Hopi Native American tribe in northeastern Arizona, as well as exploring the strategies used by a variety of wildlife, including mustangs, coyotes and desert tortoises, to survive in these demanding environments

programme.title: Wilderness with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon travels through Patagonia at the foot of the South American continent, a beautiful and rugged land of mountains, ice and endless wild grasslands, His journey takes him up to the huge South Patagonian ice field, through the foothills of the Andes towards the great Grey Glacier of eastern Chile. In Taibo and Jauny, Simon encounters two gauchos, the cowboys of South America, who live isolated lives in the mountains, tending their livestock and braving the storms in a simple hut for months on end

programme.title: Big Cats 24/7
programme.desc: Dominant male lions Big Toe and Madumo disappear after fighting intruders, leaving the family exposed, with sub-adult males Colin and Ngkonne coming of age, but not yet big enough to challenge intruders. Greg Hartman follows Xudum the leopard as she strays into dangerous territory looking for a mate, while local film-maker Rea Schulte to Brinke finds Pobe the cheetahs daughter

programme.title: The Future of Nature
programme.desc: How oceans and organisms within them play a fundamental role in removing carbon from the atmosphere

programme.title: The Americas
programme.desc: Wildlife in the north of the American continent, from wolves and polar bears competing for prey in Hudson Bay to male walruses singing together off Alaskas coast. In summer, millions of salmon begin their epic journey upstream, while newborn caribou navigate dangerous river crossings on their first migratory trek. In Alberta, sharp-tailed grouse practise their courtship dances under car headlights

programme.title: Absolute Power
programme.desc: A burglar witnesses a murder involving the US president and flees the scene of the crime before the police arrive. However, a dogged detective is swiftly on his trail, and the thief realises he faces a race against time to uncover the evidence before shadowy secret service agents silence him for good. Thriller, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood, with Gene Hackman, Ed Harris, Judy Davis and Dennis Haysbert

programme.title: Home Rescue: The Big Fix
programme.desc: The team visits Karen Fitzgerald and Will Lennon at their three-bed terraced house in the Dublin suburb of Drimnagh. Karen, originally from Limerick, and Will, from New Zealand, share the house with their two sons, Seb, 12, and Ailbe, eight, who has autism and is non-verbal
