programme.title: The Cinema List: Horror Villains
programme.desc: This Halloween, face terror in every form: from the haunted halls of The Shining to the unseen menace of The Invisible Man, this collection delivers horror at its finest

programme.title: Restore Point
programme.desc: In central Europe during 2041, a female detective investigates the case of a slain couple where a restoration team is able to bring one of them back to life. Sci-fi thriller, starring Andrea Mohylova, Matej Hádek and Milan Ondrík

programme.title: Omni Loop
programme.desc: A Florida woman decides to solve time travel in order to go back and be the person she always intended. Sci-fi drama, starring Mary-Louise Parker and Ayo Edebiri

programme.title: Zombieland
programme.desc: A mutated virus sweeps across America, turning most of the population into hideous flesh-eating zombies. A hard-drinking fearless adventurer leads a small band of young survivors on a perilous journey through the wasteland in search of a safe haven. Comedy horror, with Woody Harrelson, Jesse Eisenberg, Emma Stone and Abigail Breslin

programme.title: Kong: Skull Island
programme.desc: Years after two enemy pilots land on a mysterious unchartered island in the Pacific, a team of scientists embark on a top-secret mission to the same region. Things soon descend into chaos when the local wildlife proves far from welcoming, and they must battle to escape from the domain of the mighty Kong. Action adventure, starring Tom Hiddleston, Samuel L Jackson and Brie Larson

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: A Manhattan-based military scientist finds himself immune to a virus that turns humans into ferocious vampire-like creatures. After the disease has swept across the world, wiping out an estimated 90 per cent of the human population, he devotes his solitary existence to finding a cure by unlocking the secret within his blood. Sci-fi thriller, starring Will Smith, Alice Braga and Charlie Tahan

programme.title: Men in Black
programme.desc: A streetwise cop is enlisted by a top-secret government force dedicated to policing alien visitors to Earth, teaming up with a veteran agent just as a body-swapping extraterrestrial giant insect begins a reign of terror throughout New York City. Sci-fi comedy, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Linda Fiorentino, Rip Torn and Vincent DOnofrio

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Agent J investigates the unauthorised landing of a spacecraft and discovers a malevolent alien disguised as a lingerie model is on the verge of destroying humanity. His only hope of stopping her diabolical plot is to restore the memory of his retired partner K - but his former mentor takes more than a little convincing. Sci-fi comedy sequel, directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Rosario Dawson, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rip Torn and Tony Shalhoub

programme.title: Men in Black 3
programme.desc: An alien criminal escapes from a prison on the moon and goes back in time on a mission of revenge, changing the course of history. Agent J of the top-secret Earth defence organisation follows him back to 1969, and joins forces with a younger version of his mentor Agent K to set things right. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Will Smith, Josh Brolin and Tommy Lee Jones

A scientist learns the world is soon to face a global cataclysm that will wipe out the human race, but finds the US president has plans to secretly save a fraction of the population, leaving everyone else to die. A writer learns of this scheme, and as the world is devastated by earthquakes and volcanic eruptions, he tries to get his family to the last safe refuge. Disaster epic, starring John Cusack and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Timestalker
programme.desc: A woman is condemned to squander her life in pursuit of a man who does not return her admiration, and she only comes to her senses after lingering briefly in heavenly limbo. Fantasy comedy, written, directed by and starring Alice Lowe, with Jacob Anderson, Nick Frost and Tanya Reynolds

programme.title: The Invisible Man
programme.desc: An abused woman flees for her life and takes refuge with a family. It later appears that Cecilia Kasss ex has killed himself and shes due to inherit a fortune, but the fact he was experimenting with an invisibility suit makes her think hes come after her. Thriller, starring Elisabeth Moss, Oliver Jackson-Cohen and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: If You Were the Last
programme.desc: Adrift in their broken shuttle with little hope of rescue, two astronauts argue over whether theyre better off spending their remaining days as friends or something more. Romantic comedy, starring Anthony Mackie and Zoe Chao

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: Two small-time crooks kidnap the inventor of a highly intelligent law-enforcement robot. They force him to reprogram the android so it will help them carry out an audacious heist worth $200million, but in doing so, incur the wrath of a ruthless and corrupt general. Sci-fi thriller, starring Sharlto Copley, Hugh Jackman and Dev Patel

programme.title: Dark Skies
programme.desc: Daniel and Lacy Barretts relatively peaceful existence is disturbed when strange things begin to happen around their suburban home. As the situation escalates, the couple become convinced they are being tormented by alien visitors, but when they get in touch with an expert in extraterrestrial activity, they realise their ordeal has only just begun. Sci-fi horror, starring Keri Russell, Josh Hamilton and Dakota Goyo.

programme.title: R.I.P.D.
programme.desc: A cop is murdered in the line of duty by his crooked partner, and ends up recruited by a supernatural police force. Teaming up with a Wild West lawman, he is sent back to Earth to prevent ghosts from causing chaos and uncovers a plot to overrun the land of the living with evil spirits. Fantasy adventure, with Ryan Reynolds and Jeff Bridges

programme.title: Total Recall

However, the procedure uncovers the fact that he really is a spy with his memory erased, and he is forced to become a fugitive from the totalitarian government. Sci-fi thriller remake, with Colin Farrell, Kate Beckinsale and Jessica Biel

American comedy, starring Sarah Jessica Parker, Cynthia Nixon, Kim Cattrall and Kristin Davis

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Miranda realises having a partner on her arm can only benefit her career when her credibility rockets after her bosses become convinced she is gay. Meanwhile, Carrie has a run-in with a flasher, Samantha gets to know a doorman better and Charlottes new romance comes to an abrupt end. Starring Cynthia Nixon and Kim Cattrall

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: The girls ponder the pros and cons of dating younger men, while Charlottes boyfriend puts her on the spot with an unusual request. Comedy, starring Sarah Jessica Parker

programme.sub-title: The Third Wheel Gets the Grace
programme.desc: Will returns from holiday in France and spends every moment with Grace, provoking Nathans jealousy, and a proud Jack takes his son shopping. Woody Harrelson guest stars

programme.title: Will and Grace
programme.desc: Wills old adversary is hired to work at the law firm, filling him with the dread of renewed hostilities. Grace searches for the perfect gift for Nathans birthday but is outdone by Karen, leading to a game of one-upmanship destined to end in tears. Comedy, guest starring Woody Harrelson and Adam Goldberg

programme.title: Will and Grace
programme.desc: Will tires of Karens constant false alarms and vows to ignore her. Unfortunately, the moment he turns his back, the FBI turns up asking awkward questions about her husband. Meanwhile, Jack persuades Grace to accompany Elliot to a high-school dance. Comedy, starring Eric McCormack and Debra Messing

programme.title: Will and Grace
programme.desc: Will proves to be a talented actor, while Grace accepts an invitation to move into Karens penthouse - but soon outstays her welcome. American sitcom, starring Eric McCormack and Debra Messing

programme.title: Curb Your Enthusiasm
programme.desc: Larry heads to Georgia to appear at the birthday party of a prominent businessman, while Leon takes the opportunity to visit his Auntie Rae. Later, Larry has some trouble with his glasses and faces off with a surly hotel cleaner. Final series of the comedy, starring Larry David

programme.title: Curb Your Enthusiasm
programme.desc: Still in Atlanta, Larry finds himself stuck at a rental home with a questionable lawn ornament, while Jeff pays the price for taking Larrys advice for Susies birthday gift

programme.title: Curb Your Enthusiasm
programme.desc: Larrys improved golf game causes trouble with an acclaimed actor, while Freddy helps his neighbours through a delicate issue

programme.title: Yacht Rock: A Dockumentary
programme.desc: Chronicling the rise of the soft rock sound pioneered by artists including Steely Dan, Toto and Michael McDonald, exploring its widespread influence

programme.title: When We Were Kings
programme.desc: Leon Gasts Oscar-winning documentary charting the challenge of an ageing Muhammad Ali for George Foremans World Heavyweight title held in Zaire in 1974. The film explores the impact of Alis visit to Africa before focusing on the epic fight, dubbed the Rumble in the Jungle, which has gone down in history as one of the greatest of all time. Spike Lee and Norman Mailer are among the contributors offering personal opinions on its importance to them

programme.title: Going Clear: Scientology and the Prison of Belief
programme.desc: Alex Gibneys documentary, based on Lawrence Wrights book, sheds light on the controversial religious movement, from its roots in the mind of founder L Ron Hubbard through to its rise in popularity in Hollywood and beyond. The film also profiles eight former members of the Church of Scientology, including Oscar-winning screenwriter and director Paul Haggis, who offer their perspective on the actions of the organisations leaders past and present

programme.title: Bobby Robson: More Than a Manager
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the career of the much-loved former England, Barcelona and Newcastle United manager. Via the Hand of God and Paul Gascoignes tears, to titles across Europe, Robson overcame the most extreme challenges - including fighting for his life after being diagnosed with cancer - before returning to football to manage his beloved Newcastle

programme.title: Be Water
programme.desc: A look at Bruce Lees time in Hong Kong making four films, exploring questions of identity and representation through rare archive, intimate interviews, and Lees writings

programme.title: Searching for Sugar Man
programme.desc: Documentary following two fans in search of their musical idol. American singer Sixto Rodriguez enjoyed a brief recording career in the 1970s before fading into obscurity. However, his politically conscious music became incredibly popular in South Africa. Bizarre stories of his death had circulated over the years, but two devotees plan to find out what really became of him

programme.title: Great Photo, Lovely Life: Facing a Familys Secret
programme.desc: Renowned photojournalist Amanda Mustard returns home to Pennsylvania to investigate the multiple sexual abuse crimes committed by her grandfather

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: Origins
programme.desc: A look at various underground structures, including Derinkuyu, a multi-level underground city in Turkey large enough to have sheltered up to 20,000 people, their animals and food stores and the Longyou Grottoes in China, believed to be over 15,000 years old. Plus, secret tunnels linked to Native American lore of the Ant and Snake People and ancient libraries from a lost civilization

programme.title: The Sound and the Fury
programme.desc: Key events of the Second World War, beginning with Germany invading Poland, and touching on Japans expansion in Asia. Plus, how Africas colonies became key battlegrounds for power and resources

programme.title: The Sound and the Fury
programme.desc: Events of 1941, when Hitler invaded the USSR. Plus, Operation Barbarossa stalled as winter hits and Soviet resistance - fuelled by propaganda - turned the tide

programme.title: The Lost Women Spies
programme.desc: The story of Britains first female agents sent to the front line during the Second World War and spymistress Vera Atkins, who led them. In the tumult of the conflict, French Resistance fighters sought aid from Britains Special Operations Executive (SOE) against Nazi occupation. Led by Romanian-born Atkins, SOE enlisted female agents including Odette Sansom and Noor Inayat Khan to take the fight to the Germans. As tensions soared, Noor navigated occupied France, while Atkins grappled with tough decisions. She and her team raced against time to safeguard SOEs mission, braving sacrifices for victory

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on an expedition along Dorsets Jurassic coast to explore the countys hidden Second World War story. Starting beside the defences on Chesil Beach, he heads east to finish in Swanage and Studland Bay. On his five-day walk he encounters stunning scenery and uncovers wartime acts of ingenuity and bravery. He also discovers the crucial part a swannery played in developing a secret weapon and reveals the role of Dorset in protecting Britain from invasion during the conflict

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits more archaeological sites around the country, with digs in southern England revealing a previously unknown Roman town, a Tudor ship buried beneath a quarry and evidence of Henry VIIIs financial forgery under the Tower of London

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.sub-title: Headless Romans and Anglo Saxon Gold
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits more archaeological digs around the country, finding out about a gatehouse riddled with Civil War bullets, a unique Iron Age shield made from bark, and Roman burials with pots where the heads should be

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: A countdown of the top 10 most interesting reported alien encounters

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Reported accounts of alien encounters, hearing from people who believe that beings from other worlds have the means to control humanity

programme.title: The Lost Women Spies
programme.desc: Amid the chaos of D-Day, alarming wireless messages revealed Special Operations Executive (SOE) disloyalty. While concerns escalated, Allied troops advanced and Paris was liberated. SOE operations subsequently dwindled, prompting Second World War spymistress Vera Atkins to confront the harm done to her agents

programme.title: The Lost Women Spies
programme.desc: While Europe rejoiced over victory in the Second World War, Odette Hallowes struggle at Ravensbruck revealed telling information about other agents in prison. Spymistress Vera Atkins investigation intensified in Karlsruhe prison and Ravensbruck, focusing on espionage agent Noor Inayat Khans fate

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson sets off on a 45-mile hike through the countryside of the Weald in Kent and the Downs of East Sussex to discover the areas rich and surprising Tudor heritage. At Penshurst Place, author Philippa Gregory helps him relish the fate of the Grand Duke of Buckingham at the hands of the young Henry VIII. From there, he travels up what used to be secret paths to Hever Castle and finds out how the monarchs reign brought not only huge social, political and industrial change, but also fame and disaster to the women who caught his eye He ends this leg of his journey in Lewes, where he relives one of the more brutal monastic dissolutions

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on a 45-mile walk across Wiltshire, from Avebury to Stonehenge, telling the story of the remarkable development that occurred in the latter days of the Neolithic era. His route over chalk downlands and Salisbury Plain takes him through one of the greatest concentrations of prehistoric sites in Europe

programme.title: The Nostradamus Effect
programme.desc: Examining the plausibility of apocalyptic prophecies throughout history. This edition focuses on Isaac Newtons obsession with alchemy and biblical prophecies

programme.title: The Nostradamus Effect
programme.desc: In 1947, ancient scrolls were discovered in desert caves near the Dead Sea. One of them spells out - in chilling detail - a future apocalyptic war. This documentary considers the plausibility of such prophecies

programme.title: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: The secret underground pathways of Scotland that reveal the degree of sophistication of the culture 700 years ago, when William Wallace fought for the countrys independence

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: Origins
programme.desc: A look at various underground structures, including Derinkuyu, a multi-level underground city in Turkey large enough to have sheltered up to 20,000 people, their animals and food stores and the Longyou Grottoes in China, believed to be over 15,000 years old. Plus, secret tunnels linked to Native American lore of the Ant and Snake People and ancient libraries from a lost civilization

programme.title: Secrets Declassified with David Duchovny
programme.desc: Through use of recently declassified CIA documents, the X-Files actor uncovers some of the most closely guarded government secrets from post-war history. These are mysteries and conspiracies some have long suspected, but are yet to hear answers to

programme.title: Secrets Declassified with David Duchovny
programme.desc: The actor investigates daring government operations, revealing uncensored evidence and the lengths to which elite operatives have gone to complete missions. Examples include the record-shattering depths submarine divers have plunged to tap a secret Soviet communication line to the Special Ops team of suicidal soldiers sent to hand-deploy A-bombs in enemy territory

programme.title: WWIIs Most Daring Raids
programme.desc: In July 1943 the Allied Forces had evicted the Axis powers from North Africa and could finally begin the Italian Campaign. The first mission was Operation Husky, a massive amphibious invasion of the island of Sicily

programme.title: WWII Battles in Colour
programme.desc: Gripping real life stories - when the fate of nations hung in the balance - are brought to life in never-before-seen colourised battle footage. This instalment illustrates life and death on the battlefield of El Alamein and life behind the lines in the north African desert

programme.title: WWII Lost Films
programme.desc: A battle contested between the Japanese and Americans at the small island of Tarawa, which ended up costing 1,500 US troops their lives. Plus, a battle fought in New Britain and the invasion of Sicily

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at the most compelling investigations of all, and events that he believes represent real encounters with extraterrestrial visitors

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A 20th-century British woman who stunned Egyptologists by accurately locating structures and artefacts

programme.title: The Sound and the Fury
programme.desc: In 1943, Germany fell at Stalingrad, its first major defeat. In the Pacific, Japan lost momentum after the US won at Guadalcanal

programme.title: The Sound and the Fury
programme.desc: In 1944, D-Day pierced the Atlantic Wall, as Operation Bagration crushed the Wehrmacht in the East. Plus, the fall of the Third Reich began

programme.title: The Lost Women Spies
programme.desc: The story of Britains first female agents sent to the front line during the Second World War and spymistress Vera Atkins, who led them. In the face of danger, Vera ramped up her recruitment of female agents. Chaos ensued as the Prosper circuit in Paris neared collapse. Meanwhile, Noor, deep in Parisian resistance, struggled to maintain cover. Vera enlisted agents like Violette Szabo and Yvonne Baseden, but uncertainty shrouds their upcoming missions

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on expeditions through some of Britains most historic landscapes in search of the richest stories from the nations past. He begins with a 40-mile walk along the Derwent Valley in the Peak District, where the worlds industrial revolution was born. En route he visits the sleepy village of Cromford to find out about the work of entrepreneur Richard Arkwright, and stops off at a 900-year-old stately home that has been used as the location for three Jane Eyre films. Brian Blessed also introduces Tony to the joys - and the significance - of the Cromford canal, before this leg of his journey ends in Derby

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.sub-title: Arthurs Stone and a Georgian Mine
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits more archaeological digs around the country, finding out about discoveries that shed new light on British history during the prehistoric, Roman, Saxon and Tudor eras. In this edition she heads to a spectacular monument that is older than Stonehenge, a 200-year-old mine trapped in time, and a lost medieval friary

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.sub-title: Mystery Shipwreck and a Roman Army Camp
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits more archaeological digs around the country, finding out about discoveries that shed new light on British history during the prehistoric, Roman, Saxon and Tudor eras. In this edition, she examines a Dutch ship sunk by the English, a Cornish Roman fort and a 5,000-year-old Neolithic monument

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Theorists investigate whether extraterrestrials might have inspired Adolf Hitler to embark on a crazed quest for global domination, and try to track down the Fuhrers alien secret

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts unseal the truth about the potential aliens living and working among humans

programme.title: The Lost Women Spies
programme.desc: Assigned to the British War Crime Investigation Unit in post-war Germany, British intelligence officer Vera Atkins pursued her agents fate at Natzweiler and Ravensbruck. Piecing together testimonies, she insisted on obtaining official records to substantiate her findings for upcoming trials. While Vera sought justice for her girls, a letter challenged her verdicts on Noor’s fate. Suspicions of double agents led Vera to hunt down a Nazi mastermind. She was still to determine whether any agents had escapeed, and if not who had betrayed them

programme.title: The Lost Women Spies
programme.desc: How the capture of a key Nazi uncovered shocking realities. Amid demands for accountability, spymistress Vera Atkins and her team had to navigate murky waters to confront uncomfortable truths

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson goes on a four-day trek through the Kintail region of the north-western Highlands, examining the story of the Jacobite uprisings of the early 1700s along the way. He starts by visiting Iron Age dwellings in Shiel Bridge, and heads to the rebuilt castle on Eilean Donan, the original of which was destroyed after invading Spanish troops landed there and were attacked by British warships. Tony ends in Glen Shiel, the site of a climactic battle in 1719 where royalist troops defeated the rebels

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts heads to a farmers field in Rutland to examine evidence of a Roman barn conversion, featuring a three-room spa, including underfloor and in-wall central heating. She also finds out about the excavation of one of Henry VIIIs lost forts in Hull, and hears from a team that discovered stunning 10,000-year-old hunting tools near Scarborough

programme.title: Bradley Walsh: Egypts Cosmic Code
programme.desc: The presenter and one-time Rolls Royce engineer fulfils a lifetimes ambition to visit the monuments of Ancient Egypt in a bid to understand how it could have been possible to produce such wonders of the ancient world 4,500 years ago. An expert guide is on hand to lay out the mainstream thinking and act as the perfect foil for Bradley and his theories

programme.title: Bradley Walsh: Egypts Cosmic Code
programme.desc: The presenter dives deeper into Egypts mysteries, exploring the Great Sphinx and the underground Serapeum with its precision-cut granite sarcophagi, questioning their purpose and links to the pyramid enigma. Travelling south, he visits the intricately designed Dendera Temple, where hieroglyphs and imagery hint at possible extraterrestrial connections. He concludes at the sprawling Karnak temple complex, marvelling at its monumental engineering, sphinx-lined avenues, and Hatshepsuts towering obelisk - wondering whether its simply a monument or a channel for cosmic energy

programme.title: Bradley Walsh: Egypts Cosmic Code
programme.desc: The presenter sets out to uncover the mysteries of King Tutankhamun. Along the way, he encounters the enigmatic Alien King Akhenaten and his wife, Nefertiti. Sailing down the Nile, he investigates how the Ancient Egyptians transported enormous stone blocks for their architectural marvels, including the 700-ton Colossi of Memnon. His quest then leads him into the Valley of the Kings, where he discovers the resting places of Akhenaten and King Tuts successor, Horemheb - before finally coming face to face with the mummy of the Boy King himself

programme.title: Secrets Declassified with David Duchovny
programme.desc: Declassified files reveal bizarre military weapons policies, that somehow balance between apocalyptic and absurd. They include atomic tests 1,500 times stronger than Hiroshima to CIA poison guns and plots to feminise Hitler

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores Plymouths history during the Elizabethan era, visiting the home of the citys most famous son, Sir Francis Drake, and uncovering his history of piracy and slave trading - all carried out with approval from the Queen. She also discovers the revolutionary shipbuilding techniques that helped defeat the Spanish Armada, while aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson highlights the physical characteristics that made Plymouth Harbour such an attractive base for pirates

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts is in Glasgow to investigate the impact of steam power on Britains major towns in the 18th and 19th centuries. She also learns about the arrival of migrant workers in the city and how the insanitary conditions in which they lived, which made Glasgow both a hotbed of disease and a place of great medical advancement. Aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson flies his drone over Loch Katrine as he tells the story of how Victorian engineers overcame geographical barriers to bring fresh drinking water to the workers of Glasgow

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores Edinburgh and its role in the union between England and Scotland. She discovers how the famous case of Burke and Hares bodysnatching influenced British medical law, and visits the Royal Bank of Scotland, where she uncovers evidence of the worlds first overdraft. Plus, the role played by Henry Dundas, whose statue stands in St Andrews Square, in the continuation of the slave trade

programme.title: Digging for Britain

programme.title: Digging for Britain

programme.title: Jack the Ripper: Written in Blood
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary exploring how the Whitechapel Murders fuelled the rise of tabloid journalism in Victorian Britain, highlighting how the press manipulated the story for its own gain, ultimately obstructing justice in the process. One Fleet Street newspaper in particular - the Star - shamelessly exploitated the killings to boost circulation and profits, hindering the police investigation to further its own agenda. With Moe Dunford, Chelsea Halfpenny, Tyger Drew-Honey and Mark Strepan

programme.title: Jack the Ripper: Written in Blood
programme.desc: With Whitechapel in panic, the Star incites violent anti-Semitic clashes, while the police struggle and the real murderer strikes again and again. Moe Dunford, Chelsea Halfpenny, Tyger Drew-Honey and Mark Strepan star in this dramatised documentary

programme.title: Jack the Ripper: Written in Blood

With Moe Dunford, Chelsea Halfpenny, Tyger Drew-Honey and Mark Strepan

programme.desc: McGarrett and Grover join forces to bring in a young man who has a large amount of parking tickets, but it turns out that he is actually a skilled computer hacker looking to sell secrets that could be a threat to national security. Elsewhere, Sato has some news to share with Kono

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Thanksgiving proves eventful when the remains of a secret service agent turn up in a barrel, heralding a deadly plot to kill none other than the US president. Meanwhile, McGarrett has a surprise in store when his colourful Aunt Deb pays a visit. Carol Burnett guest stars

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The attempted murder of a Pearl Harbour veteran at a remembrance ceremony leads McGarrett and the gang to uncover the story of a killing at a wartime internment camp in Honolulu. Using decades-old evidence, can the team finally solve the crime? Alex OLoughlin and Scott Caan star

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Things are far from merry at Christmas for the Five-0, particularly Chin. Danger looms for the detective when the discovery of a dead body bearing the hallmarks of a professional hit-job leads him onto the trail of a serial killer. Meanwhile, Danny and daughter Grace find a mysterious puzzle box washed up on the shores of Oahu. Alex OLoughlin, Scott Caan and Daniel Dae Kim star

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: O Kela Me Keia Manawa (Now and Then)
programme.desc: McGarrett joins forces with Grover to help him track down an old friend who has done a runner after apparently committing murder. Danny flirts with a woman he meets at a petrol station - but gets a shock when she ends up shot - and Kono continues her search for Adam

programme.title: SEAL Team
programme.desc: Jason returns to Bravo and tensions rise when Ray outranks him on a mission to recover military drones in Syria. Meanwhile, Sonny receives surprising news from Texas

programme.title: SEAL Team

programme.title: SEAL Team
programme.desc: Jasons career and freedom hang in the balance when Command accuses him of committing a horrific crime during a mission. With Bravo under a no-contact order, Jason must fight this battle without his comrades

programme.title: SEAL Team
programme.desc: Jason is put on trial with a potential career-ending outcome, while Stella moves in with Clay, and Sonny visits Hannah to help her prepare for the arrival of their baby

programme.title: SEAL Team
programme.desc: Jason re-evaluates his role as team leader after visiting a former comrade, while several Bravo members grapple with personal relationships when Command sends them on an unexpected mission to Africa

programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: Nick and Hank investigate a murder, which leads them to a dangerously unstable fugitive on the run with his daughter. However, there may be an even greater threat close by

programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: A high-school student is killed by a monster, leading Nick and Hank to suspect that a boy competing in an academic competition is trying to eliminate his rivals

programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: Nick and Hank investigate when a child goes missing, uncovering several similar cases all linked by sightings of a mysterious ghostly presence. It transpires that the Weeping Woman - or La Llorona - is a ghost who kidnaps three children every Halloween and drowns them, hoping their sacrifice can atone for the loss of her own children, whom she also drowned. David Giuntoli stars

programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: After experiencing disturbing visions, Nick discovers a fellow Grimm is torturing and murdering monsters that have harmed humans, spreading panic among the Wesen creatures. Renard and Juliettes connection moves to the next level. David Giuntoli stars

programme.title: Rob and Romesh Vs
programme.desc: Rob Beckett and Romesh Ranganathan dive into the world of drag queens, meeting RuPauls Drag Race judge Michelle Visage and stars the Vivienne and Baga Chipz as they try to to find their drag personas. They end by each performing a drag routine in front of an audience

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: During a hiking trip, Powell and Gamble stumble upon an illegal cannabis farm and find themselves taking on a dangerous cartel

programme.title: Revival
programme.desc: In the town of Wausau, Wisconsin, everyone who had died within a two-week period suddenly resurrects without explanation. While trying to keep the peace alongside her sheriff father, Deputy Dana Cypress investigates when the corpse of a horse that had been violently killed is discovered. Supernatural horror noir, starring Melanie Scrofano

programme.title: Wynonna Earp: Vengeance
programme.desc: Sci-Fi Western starring Melanie Scrofano. Wynonna Earp returns home to battle her greatest foe yet: a psychotic seductress hellbent on revenge against her and the people she loves. Based on the series Wynonna Earp

programme.title: An Idiot Abroad
programme.desc: Ricky Gervais sends Karl Pilkington on another world trip - and this time he has company in the shape of film and TV star Warwick Davis. The odd couple follow in the footsteps of legendary explorer Marco Polo from Italy to China, and while Karl offers his usual pearls of wisdom, Lifes Too Short actor Warwick samples the foreign climes from his own unique perspective. They begin their 5,000-mile journey in Venice, where they attend a masked ball, enter the inaccurately named Pleasure Machine and test-ride a jet pack

programme.title: Warrior

programme.title: Supersenses
programme.desc: The documentary asks what makes a truly super-powered animal, scouring the globe for the strangest and most surprising animal skills and, in a round of competitive challenges, revealing which creature holds the title for super strength, most toxic, master of disguise, greatest escape artist and master builder

programme.title: Supersenses
programme.desc: The amazing world of what animals really see with their extraordinary senses, thanks to remarkable CGI and innovative film techniques

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough employs the latest technologies to explore the violence, rivalries and deadly weaponry existing within the world of bugs. This first episode examines the survival tactics of its terrifying residents including killer ants, trap-setting spiders and beetles with the ability to shoot boiling chemicals at their enemies

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster continues his bug-eyed view of the world of creepy-crawlies, revealing how predators defuse the defences of their prey. Highlights include the cockroach wasp, busy preparing a tasty - and very live - treat for its young, the whirligig beetle, which employs a water-based radar system, and the jumping portia spider, which feeds on other arachnids

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A further selection of creepy-crawly close-ups, focusing on courtship in the bug world. Highlights include scorpions shaking their booty, the perfume-wearing nasonia wasp and the tropical cricket, for whom romance goes out of the window as it uses bribery to seal the deal with would-be partners. One potential partner to steer well clear of, however, is the praying mantis, the female of which is notorious for eating the male just after - or even during - mating. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A close-up view of sex, bug-style, as David Attenborough talks viewers through the different ways in which creepy-crawlies reproduce. Size matters for the minuscule male orb spider, creepily sneaking up on its intended and trying to mate without her noticing, while theres no rest for the lothario-like butterfly, which has plenty of notches on its proverbial bedpost. However, the harvestman spider has no use for sex at all, and reproduces by cloning itself

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough shifts the focus to bugs that prefer co-operation rather than conflict. They include burrowing cockroaches, the suitably named social spiders - which share a 30-metre web - the queen bee and her happy hive of workers and green ants pulling together to build a nest

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster concludes his close-up examination of the creepy-crawly world, shifting focus to the bugs ultimate invention - the colony. Key residents of these minuscule mega-cities include honey bees, termites, leafcutter ants - who have a knack for farming - and their Argentine cousins, members of a community so vast it spans an entire continent

programme.title: David Attenboroughs First Life
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part documentary, the naturalist explores the origins of life on Earth. Beginning the journey near his childhood home in Charnwood Forest, Leicestershire, he learns how a fossil discovery transformed scientists understanding of the evolution of complex organisms, and in Newfoundland and Australia he reveals the earliest kinds of animal to exist on the planet. With the help of cutting-edge technology and visual effects, the programme brings the creatures to life, demonstrating how they survived

programme.title: David Attenboroughs First Life

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster explores the Galapagos, a collection of volcanic islands in the Pacific known for its extraordinary wildlife. More than 150 years after Charles Darwin formulated his ground-breaking theory of evolution on the remote archipelago, Attenborough explains how life on the islands has continued to evolve in biological isolation, examining how the ever-changing volcanic landscape has given birth to species and sub-species that exist nowhere else in the world. He begins by revealing how Galapagos rose from the ocean four million years ago

programme.title: David Attenboroughs First Life
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part documentary, the naturalist explores the origins of life on Earth. Beginning the journey near his childhood home in Charnwood Forest, Leicestershire, he learns how a fossil discovery transformed scientists understanding of the evolution of complex organisms, and in Newfoundland and Australia he reveals the earliest kinds of animal to exist on the planet. With the help of cutting-edge technology and visual effects, the programme brings the creatures to life, demonstrating how they survived

programme.title: David Attenboroughs First Life
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part documentary, the naturalist travels to Burgess Shale in Canadas Rocky Mountains, where he explores how evolution gained pace once creatures developed mouths and mobility. In Scotland, he reveals that one of the smallest fossils found holds the secret to how animals began surviving on dry land, and explains the bloom of life during the oxygen-rich Carboniferous period

programme.title: Attenboroughs Journey
programme.desc: Documentary following David Attenborough as he journeys around the world to make his series First Life, which explores the origins of life on Earth. As he visits locations including the Great Barrier Reef, the deserts of Morocco and the glaciers of Canada, the broadcaster and wildlife expert explains his life-long fascination with the natural world, and also travels back to Leicestershire, the county in which he spent his childhood

programme.title: Rob and Romesh Vs

programme.title: Live WSL

programme.title: Caught Red Handed

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Another edition of the fly-on-the-wall documentary accessing the world of national security at Australias biggest airports, following customs and immigration officers as they go about their daily business of tackling drug runners, illegal immigrants and terrorists

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: A man returning from Vietnam has something in his bag that he doesnt want his mother to see, while an emotional American woman says she is visiting Australia to tie up some loose ends from a failed relationship - but a mystery man arrives and turns her story upside down. Two Chinese visitors squabble among themselves when officers discover prohibited items in their bags, and things get messy when searching a large container

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: A woman returning from a trip to China has a tantrum, and officers want to know why she has business cards for a Sydney brothel and passports for three unknown Chinese women. An elderly New Zealander says he has turned over a new leaf, but his track record may stop him from attending an important family event

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: A piece of salmon comes up positive for cocaine, and officers investigate when carpets from Syria have something suspicious woven through the fabric

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Officers investigate a man arriving from Beijing who has strong readings for narcotics on his belongings, while three men claim they are in Australia to visit a temple that does not appear to have been built yet. Plus, a mobile X-ray unit is needed to inspect some large rolls of fabric from Thailand

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: A Canadian woman tests positive for heroin, customs officials suspect a Malaysian tourist is illegally looking for work, and something sinister is found inside a childs laptop

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: A man tries to get a bag of meat through customs and would rather go to court than pay the fine, and a suspicious woman attracts the attention of security. Elsewhere, an Indian student has been skipping school and faces being sent home

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: A woman tries to smuggle a very expensive gift back into Australia, while an escort and his boyfriend are held in separate immigration interview rooms. Plus, an elderly lady returns from Turkey with a bag of nuts and seeds, and a light posted from Hong Kong looks suspicious under x-ray

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: A couple from the Solomon Islands are caught carrying seeds in their luggage. Fly-on-the-wall documentary accessing the world of national security at Australias biggest airports as customs and immigration officers tackle drug runners, illegal immigrants and terrorists

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Officers suspect there are drugs hidden in a mans bag, and a travelling musician, who claims to possess special powers enabling her to foretell the future, struggles to get through immigration. Meanwhile. Biosecurity officials discover an unusual concoction in the bag of a traveller

programme.title: Nothing to Declare

Shes persuaded him to go rogue and hit South Africa, and its 1.2 million square kilometres of wilderness just waiting to be explored. They begin their 800km journey getting to know each other better in Cape Town before heading inland and off-road, tackling ancient valleys, jagged mountains and vast plains seeking out adventure on their way to the tip of the continent. Richard Hammond asserts authority over the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi in the six-wheel-drive Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6x6, while James May defies his status as Captain Slow by blasting two Caterhams around the test track - the minimalist entry-level Seven 160 and the full-fat supercharged Seven 620R. programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabis Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMWs critically acclaimed M135i. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A man found beaten to death near his local turns out to be a widower with a drink problem, who has been neglecting his two children and spending a lot of time in the pub with the landlords attractive girlfriend (played by former EastEnders and Bad Girls actress Nicola Stapleton). Max returns to work following his run-in with Terry, but starts spreading rumours about a relationship between Grace and Neil, and it soon becomes clear he has not sorted out his drug problem

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: When a couple fail to turn up at the airport for a flight to Italy and their dog is found brutally killed in what appears to be a burglary at their home, suspicion falls on their son, who holds a grudge against his father for turning him in for possession of a class A drug. A neighbour produces mobile phone footage of the family car being torched by teenagers, one of whom is known to the police, and the case takes an unexpected twist when the Sun Hill team starts tracking the missing persons bank account. Former EastEnders actor Stuart Laing (Rob Minter) guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kirsty calls for help when a woman is found unconscious and with multiple injuries beneath an open window. Callum eventually responds, having just learned of his fathers death, but as the investigation slowly uncovers the activities and relationships of the residents of the house, the sergeants distracted behaviour leads to a furious outburst against his colleague witnessed by Inspector Smith

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: Pat and Marek are reconciled, but when someone sees them together, their relationship is in more danger than ever. programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: The villagers prepare for harvest time, but Steph struggles to cope with the workload and faces losing the farm if she cannot meet her quota. A newcomer to the community stirs up tension between Sarah and Frances, while Joyce and the Brindsleys also receive unexpected visitors. Teresa faces a big decision, while Sarah finds herself in a dangerous situation. Alison discovers the real reason behind the parachute accidents and makes a horrifying connection to the factory. She races to warn Frances before it is too late

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: The village prepares for Nick and Teresas wedding as the Battle of Britain draws to an end. Pat faces a big decision as Marek prepares to leave, but Bob intends to ruin her plans. Frances fights to clear her name following the closure of the factory, Alison wrestles with her conscience, and a chance encounter leaves Joyce with some unanswered questions

programme.title: Catherine Cooksons The Round Tower

Keith Barron and Jan Harvey also star

programme.title: Last Tango in Halifax
programme.desc: Old friends Celia Dawson and Alan Buttershaw are both widowed and in their 70s, and have not seen each other for 60 years. When they are reunited over the internet and arrange to meet up, they discover it was an unfortunate twist of fate that prevented them getting together all those years ago. All at once, their feelings for each other are reignited and they make a snap decision. But when their daughters - buttoned-up headmistress Caroline and happy-go-lucky farmer Gillian - arrive at the pub to pick their parents up, how will they feel about becoming sisters-in-law? Sally Wainwrights light-hearted drama stars Derek Jacobi and Anne Reid as the second-time-around lovers, with Sarah Lancashire and Nicola Walker

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Felix acts as a police adviser during the production of a bawdy film, on which the abrasive director is managing to rub everyone up the wrong way. Despite being incapacitated with a leg injury, Sister Boniface is called in to assist when a murder occurs on the set. Lorna Watson and Jerry Iwu star

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. There is little sympathy when child-killer James Wade dies in his cell, but Leos encounter with dying ex-prison inspector Rachel Kruger compels him to investigate the notorious Redhill jail - only to come up against a wall of silence. Meanwhile, Harry meets Wades sister Miriam and agrees to help find her brothers killer. Forensic crime drama, starring William Gaminara, Emilia Fox and Tom Ward, with Juliet Aubrey, Gillian Kearney and Jaye Griffiths

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the kidnapping of two boys in 1979, which they believe could be linked to a recent spate of disappearances. The youngsters involved in the earlier case escaped - though their abductor was never found. Fearing they may be on the trail of a serial killer, the detectives also uncover a link with another unsolved case - the assault on a champion fisherman

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Davies is saddened by the death of a harmless local tramp known for his penchant for collecting waste paper in a pram. The detectives instincts, along with the intervention of social services officer Jemma Duval, lead him to pursue the case, uncovering a wartime mystery along the way. Norman Wisdom stars alongside Peter Davison and Sean Hughes

programme.title: 2point4 Children
programme.desc: Jenny prepares to leave for college, while superstitious Ben takes a series of increasingly bizarre measures to ensure his favourite football team keeps winning, press-ganging the rest of the family into helping

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: When a member of a ceilidh band is slain Sister Boniface must catch the killer at Mrs Clams birthday party

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney mourn Grandads death, and feel gratified to see such a good turn-out of friends and relatives at his funeral - even if most people are more interested in the food afterwards. programme.title: Only Fools and Horses

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: Gary invents a promiscuous past to hide his sexual inexperience from Dorothy. Meanwhile, Tony tries to impress Deborah with his athletic prowess by turning up at her keep-fit class - but soon regrets his rash move. Comedy, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Leslie Ash and Caroline Quentin

programme.title: Men Behaving Badly
programme.desc: The housemates have a sleepless night as pyjama-clad Gary goes in search of a 24-hour chemist to cure Dorothys indigestion and Deborah sends Tony to mend a squeaking fence. Comedy, starring Martin Clunes, Neil Morrissey, Leslie Ash and Caroline Quentin

programme.desc: Stage show of the comedy series from 1995, in which Richie and Eddie try to invite the Queen for supper. Starring Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson

programme.title: Toast of London
programme.desc: First episode of the comedy following the life of an eccentric actor with a chequered past, starring Matt Berry. Things are looking up for Steven Toast - his agent Jane Plough reveals hes won an award in a trendy magazine and hes getting a lot of attention from the opposite sex, in particular celebrity journalist Susan Random and the slightly unhinged Jemima Gina. Co-starring Doon Mackichan, Emma Fryer, Morgana Robinson and Robert Bathurst

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part story, Lewis sinks deeper into trouble as his undercover operation spins out of control. Following a shoot-out with the East Street gang, he is ordered to act as courier when a hostage is exchanged for a gun the Skens are eager to get their hands on - and finds he is in danger from both sides. Back at the station, Mickey and Kezia work on a case in which explosives have gone missing from a contractors depot. Concludes tomorrow

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: In the tense conclusion of the two-part story, Heaton briefs the team on the Skens plan to ambush a cash van, but Lewis alerts them to a last-minute change of plan - the stolen explosives are to be used to rescue gang leader Wayne Jackson from a prison vehicle on the courthouse run. A high-speed car chase through the London streets ensues, observed from the air by Jack until the getaway car enters a tunnel. The trail goes cold, leaving Lewis in the hands of the increasingly suspicious gangsters

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Darren Day guest stars as a photographer arrested on suspicion of murdering one of his models. The discovery of a blood-soaked T-shirt at his trashed studio, and the evidence of his own pictures, suggests a second suspect may have delivered the fatal blows to the victims head. Emma and Beth tangle with a trio of truculent young women whose troubled history of deceit and blackmail leads to violence, putting the young PCs in danger

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: CID officers attend the funeral of murdered supermodel Cindy Statham, only to learn that killer Larry Franks has been transferred to hospital following a suicide bid. When he makes a break for freedom, a frantic search of the building ensues and Beth is first to pick up the trail of blood. Smithys first day as Acting Inspector goes from bad to worse when he calls in the Firearms Command to sort out a building society robbery by two bungling ex-employees

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Larry Franks withdraws his confession to the murder of supermodel Cindy Statham and Jo reopens the case, convinced they have the wrong man in custody. Crime scene photographer Rachel Inns helps her work late into the night re-examining the evidence. Mickey investigates a smash-and-grab raid on a jewellery shop and ends up arresting an old friend, Mod cafe owner Jerry Harper, whose daughter owns the scooter used as a getaway vehicle

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: A look at the busiest ambulance service in Sydney. Paramedics go to a warehouse where a forklift has rolled over and face a car accident where a pregnant womans waters have broken

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Its the weekend and a rookie paramedic faces a confronting case, a young boy is trapped seizing in a bathroom, and a stranger must be convinced to perform lifesaving CPR

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: An ambulance bottleneck sends dispatch into overload, and officers are called on site to a car crash, where the vehicle is wrapped around a tree

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: A heart attack turns into a race against time, while a double stabbing pushes the ambulance services to their limits

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Football pundit Lee Dixon brings his beloved rescue dog to see Professor Noel Fitzpatrick, looking for help treating a limp and getting his pet back to full fitness. Elsewhere, a Springer Spaniel all the way from Guernsey is brought in for spinal surgery, and a Caucasian Shepherd puppy called Bear requires two hip replacements

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: In the first of a new series, Professor Noel Fitzpatrick and his team treat a giant Newfoundland puppy with a painful knee and shoulder. What appears straightforward quickly turns into a much bigger concern, and Noel and his team are challenged to invent not one but two new implants for her. Meanwhile, a rescue black Labrador called Moogi is in need of treatment for severe elbow arthritis, and a golden Labrador born with a deformed front paw is offered a bionic solution in the form of a unique, custom-made prosthesis

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: People who have featured on the programme share their experiences of parenthood and the challenges it has brought them, including 30-year-old Kerry and 39-year-old Paul, whose daughter Emily is exhibiting classic signs of sibling rivalry. A man who feared his party lifestyle was over when his girlfriend fell pregnant talks about his new routine, and the programme catches up with 43-year-old Shelagh, who separated from the father of her child three years ago

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: People who have featured on the programme share their experiences of parenthood and the challenges it has brought them, including Janet and Vicki, who were looking forward to having a child after four rounds of fertility treatment. A couple who had a girl two years ago reveal how they brought their plans for another baby forward after a cervical cancer scare, and are now expecting a boy. Plus, the chance to catch up with Nicola and Craig, who arrived on the labour ward of the Leeds General Infirmary with strict birthing rules

programme.title: Bad Girls Behind Bars
programme.desc: Heroin addict Missy is regularly visited by a sugar daddy, who gives her the cash she needs to fund her habit. But as she awaits trial for kidnapping, she has to decide whether she is willing to give up a life of drugs and money in order to get her children back. Meanwhile, the romance between transgender prisoner Franklin and fellow inmate Leslie continues to blossom. Only able to meet in educational classes, will their relationship be discovered by the officers?

programme.title: Bad Girls Behind Bars
programme.desc: Educated Julia does not match the typical image of a hardened criminal but has been charged with the murder of her ex-boyfriend. Now she must learn to navigate jail for the first time - all while proclaiming her innocence. Rachel feels the full weight of prison rule after failing a drugs test, while Missy, who is facing trial for kidnapping and home invasion, discovers she could face up to 20 years. How will the mum-of-three cope with such a long term?

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers fly solo this week, giving them a chance to demonstrate their individual abilities as they transform shepherd huts into boutique boltholes on a glampsite in north Wales. The client is a brand-new business so they have a blank canvas to work on, and having been given individual briefs by Michelle Ogundehin, each designer takes a different approach to turning these tiny spaces into luxury living accommodation, with the challenge of an en-suite shower room and an outdoor space thrown in for good measure. What will Michelle and guest judge Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen make of the end results?

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Ambulance crew mates Laura and Jason treat a 74-year-old woman who is having a stroke. Olly and V are called to a man whose heart is beating dangerously fast

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The fly-on-the-wall documentary focuses on everyday situations in the neonatal ward, which treats one in 10 of the babies born at the maternity hospital. Parents anxiously await news of their twins, who were born 17 weeks premature, and a couple remain positive that one of their newborn triplets will soon be able to join his two brothers at home

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A 19-year-old looks forward to becoming a mother after being told she might never get pregnant. Meanwhile, a woman who is terrified of needles dreads the prospect of undergoing an epidural, and a lesbian couple prepare for the birth of their second child

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary observing the lives of staff at Princess Anne maternity hospital in Southampton, who - led by co-ordinator midwife Kay Duggan - help patients meet the challenges of becoming parents. In the first programme, two teenage sweethearts wait to meet their baby, and a woman who confesses to having a low pain threshold waits nervously with her husband

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A couple who never dreamed of having children wait eagerly to meet their baby, and a mother-to-be is in high spirits until she hears screams from a nearby delivery room. Meanwhile, a woman invites her sister to join her at the birth, but she struggles to provide support when nausea strikes

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A mother-to-be who thought she might never have children because she was born with a major heart defect waits for the arrival of her first child, and her partner is on hand to offer support when her spirits begin to flag. Meanwhile, a woman fears her labour could be a repeat of the previous one, which lasted several days

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A father-to-be cannot be contacted as his girlfriends labour progresses, while another finds he has a crucial role to play when his wifes birth plans take an unexpected twist. Two women adopt different approaches to remaining calm and relieving the pressure of having a baby

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick treats a Persian cat that has been hit by a car, requiring treatments involving a skin graft and putting its crushed bones back together. Meanwhile, a rescue dog has a cancerous tumour in his jaw removed, and a young staffie-cross needs treatment for a developmental elbow disease

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A 10-month-old puppy called Albie is knocked over by a car on a family camping holiday is rushed in as an emergency admission, and Noel Fitzpatrick fears this may be a life or death situation. Elsewhere, a Scottish terrier has a mysterious ailment, and a 16-month-old spaniel, is suffering from severe arthritis affecting both hips

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Boxing Day arrives and paramedics Deena Evans and Mike Hipgrave race to 71-year-old Frank, who has severe chest pains and has had difficulty breathing after going shopping

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: One patient is flown home from holiday for an urgent operation to repair a detached retina, while another has a leaky vein that has caused an ulcer in his leg

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Emma Bunton visits Southmead Hospital to support the maternity units charity, and her arrival causes quite a stir, with midwife Sacha bringing in some treasured Spice Girls memorabilia to get signed. Meanwhile, expectant mum Tina must decide whether she has a future with her partner, and Sarahs labour progresses quickly, but she cant get in touch with her husband. Catherine and Phillip, who met online, eagerly await the start of their family life together

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sooze found the birth of her first baby easy and confidently arrives at Southmead with her husband Joe, but the contractions quickly get the better of her. Teri and Merv, who are about to have their fourth child, talk about the cravings Teri has experienced this time round, while Becki and Ian nervously await their new arrival, having finally committed to each other following an on-off romance

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The contestants pair up to redesign cafes in the seaside town of Margate, with each person responsible for their own zone. One team decide that art deco is the way to go and choose a very bold colour palette, inspired by one of Margates most famous artists, JW Turner. The other team channel the colours of the sea with cool blues and vintage shutters to create a laid-back feel. But which one will impress Michelle Ogundehin and guest judge Ross Bailey the most? Presented by Alan Carr

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance

He then travels to Paola, Kansas, where he auctions livestock and dines on spare ribs, before reaching his destination in St Joseph, Missouri

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys

Richard Wilson stars in the first-ever episode as misery guts Meldrew, with Annette Crosbie as his long-suffering wife. From 1990

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Margaret tries to take Victors mind off his depressing situation by encouraging him to attend a fitness class and read a book on how to cope with old age. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrew household is disrupted by a pesky plumber whose penchant for morbid practical jokes would try the patience of a saint. Victor decides its time to call a neighbourhood watch system after hes mugged and graffiti is spray painted on the side of the Meldrews house. David Renwicks award-winning comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor endures a sleepless night - and naturally ensures the eternally put-upon Margaret and their neighbours share in his suffering. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor returns home from a disastrous shopping trip to discover he has been burgled, and an unwelcome wedding invitation compounds his misery. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Margaret is haunted by a nightmare in which she plans to murder her husband. Meanwhile, the Meldrews neighbour is busy preparing for his annual fete. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred uncovers the construction techniques of stonemasons and carpenters through the ages, focusing on Norman cathedrals. The former steeplejack admires Peterborough Cathedral and Rochester Castle, where he demonstrates how tactics used to invade the fortress centuries ago resemble todays demolition methods

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: The ex-steeplejack tours the coast of north Wales, visiting Harlech, Caernarfon and Beaumaris to admire the defensive features of the strongholds that helped Edward I subdue the Welsh. On the orders of the king, French architect Master James of St Georges revolutionised castle design in England

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Turning his attentions to timber structures from the Middle Ages the former steeplejack visits Englands oldest fortified building with a moat, Stokesay Castle. He also journeys to Harvington Hall near Kidderminster, Worcestershire, to see how bricks became an important part of timber-framed houses

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred Dibnah demonstrates the engineering and design skills that shaped Scottish baronial style. He visits Glamis Castle to show how the sandstone tower was transformed by Italian plasterers to resemble a fairy-tale castle, and the House of Dun near Montrose, designed by William Adam

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejacks journey takes him to the North East, where he visits a pumping station that ran for 100 years before ceasing operation in 1967 and travels across the Middlesbrough Transporter Bridge. He also discovers a company in Bradford which still makes boilers in the old-fashioned way, with rivets instead of welding

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack fulfils a personal ambition by driving his traction engine across the Scammonden Bridge near Huddersfield, West Yorkshire. He also visits a forge in Sheffield and watches crucible steel being made by the experts at Abbeydale Industrial Hamlet

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1968 Honda N600 car emerges from a lock up in County Durham and Dereks in Scotland to collect an original RAC Bedford van

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.desc: Derek collects a Ford Thames 400E that once belonged to the pop band Edison Lighthouse. Dave heads to York to collect an Astra GTE convertible

programme.desc: A series of head-turning supercharged cars head to the Mathewsons auction room. Plus, going under Dereks hammer - a Ford Escort XR3 and a beautiful MGA

programme.desc: Derek heads out to pick up a pair of beautiful Swedish models - a Saab 96L and a Volvo P1800ES. Plus, a rare British AC Aceca comes up for sale

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A collection of Austin Mini Metros arrive for auction. A baby Fiat 850 coupe also goes under the hammer and a haulier offloads part of his vintage commercial vehicle collection

programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Colorado, where he follows in the footsteps of 19th-century east coast men who came to experience the cowboy life. At Bents Old Fort, he is transported back to the Mexican American War of 1848 and finds himself inspecting the troops, before heading out into the spectacular gorge of the Arkansas River aboard the historic narrow gauge Royal Gorge Railroad

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys

Michael also visits Agra, where he learns how the Taj Mahal, built by a Mughal emperor, was restored by a British viceroy at the time of his Bradshaws guide book

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Seventeen-year-old Ryan tries his hand at offshore fishing on board Ryanwood - one of a pair of the most successful trawlers in Britain. However, he is forced to battle seasickness and knows that if he does not knuckle down to work, skipper Kevin West will not be asking him to join them again

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Prawn boat Amitys engines are on the brink of failing, and skipper Jimmy Buchan has to decide whether to cut loose the £30,000 nets to ensure a safe return to port. Meanwhile, newcomer Ryan Morrison tries to impress his boss on a trawler with a reputation for success

programme.title: Trawlermen

programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drags a mini pickup out of the barn where its been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer

programme.desc: Derek points the team towards one of his favourite motors - a 1983 Daimler Double Six. And a Triumph 2000 is given a modern day makeover under the bonnet

programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus buy a Porsche 923 with a cracked interior, bad paintwork and ripped seats. This driving legend is well past its best, but they still hope to turn a profit

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how the arrival of winter sparks a ruthless battle for survival in the polar regions, with temperatures plummeting to -70C, winds reaching 120mph and day-long darkness. As a blizzard rages, a polar bear treks into the Arctic mountains to give birth, while the entire world population of spectacled eider braves the weather in a giant ice hole. Wolves and bison engage in battle, but alliances are also made, and beneath the snow, voles try to dodge the attacks of great grey owls and weasels

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the life and work of people in the polar regions, including the residents of Norilsk in Siberia, the coldest city on Earth. He also discovers how the Danish armed forces maintain their countrys claim to Greenlands natural resources by mounting a 2,000-mile dog sled patrol during the winter, and finds out how a research base at the South Pole is able to cope with being cut off from the outside world for six months at a time

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates this series exploring extreme behaviour in the natural world, uncovering some of the strategies animals have developed to stay alive and to breed, from Komodo dragons tackling buffalo to the courtship battle of the humpback whale. He begins by focusing on the methods used by creatures such as cheetahs, bottle-nosed dolphins and Venus fly-traps in their fights for survival

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals how reptiles and amphibians, including the pebble toad and Jesus Christ lizard, conquer their shortcomings by using tricks and strategies to avoid predators. He also explores how chameleons can achieve a high level of accuracy with their muscle-propelled, extendible tongues, and finds out how a 9ft-long Komodo dragon can bring down a huge water buffalo

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Part two of two. The second leg of Simons journey begins at the Giants Causeway, before visiting a kelp farm on Rathlin Island. He also learns more about Oliver Cromwells influence on Ireland, attends the Gaze film festival, and meets monkeys at an animal sanctuary in the Wicklow mountains

programme.title: The Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team continue their mission to prove to the nation that it is possible achieve a dream renovation at little cost. Changing Rooms meets the Repair Shop with a new sustainable twist, the challenge here is to transform our bland old rooms, furniture and fittings into unique and stunning show stoppers, using only upcycling and sustainable methods. This is the home makeover format for the world we live in today, as two households per week, each with a team consisting of an interior designer and an up-cycling wiz, have just four days and 1,000 euro to renovate and rejuvenate a tired spaces in their home, filling them with home-made, re-used and revamped furnishings. Two families are selected from the same region each week and each has a tired room in need of renovation and re-imagining containing a potential treasure trove of up-cycling gems

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Dallas

With Dawn French, Russ Abbot, Geraldine Chaplin, Phil Davis and Sarah Parish

programme.title: Sport Stories

Emma Willis hosts the singing contest

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?

programme.title: The Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team continue their mission to prove to the nation that it is possible achieve a dream home renovation at little cost. Changing Rooms meets the Repair Shop with a new sustainable twist, the challenge here is to transform our bland old rooms, furniture and fittings into unique and stunning show stoppers, using only upcycling and sustainable methods. This is the home makeover format for the world we live in today, as two households per week, each with a team consisting of an interior designer and an up-cycling wiz, have just four days and 1,000 euro to renovate and rejuvenate a tired spaces in their home, filling them with home-made, re-used and revamped furnishings. Two families are selected from the same region each week and each has a tired room in need of renovation and re-imagining containing a potential treasure trove of up-cycling gems

programme.title: European Qualifiers for FIFA World Cup Live
programme.desc: Northern Ireland v Slovakia (Kick-off 7.45pm). All the action from the FIFA World Cup Group A qualifier, held at Windsor Park. Northern Ireland won their opening match in the group 3-1 in Luxembourg, before losing away to Germany by the same scoreline. The Slovakians have maximum points so far after claiming a fine 2-0 win at home to the Germans, before needing a last-minute goal to win in Luxembourg. This is the first meeting between the side since a UEFA Euro 2020 play-off here, which Slovakia won 2-1 after extra time

programme.title: Ana Kriegel: A Young Life Lost
programme.desc: In May 2018, Russian-Irish teenager Ana Kriegel was lured from her home and brutally killed in a derelict house in Lucan. The awful crime was all the more disturbing when her killers were revealed to be two 13-year-old boys - now the youngest convicted murderers in the history of the state. Here, senior journalists, barristers and family friends tell Anas story, looking at the circumstances around her murder, the extensive Garda investigation and the trial that followed. Featuring a series of new photographs released by Anas family, the documentary also examines the sentencing in this unprecedented case and explores the lasting impact of Anas death

Filmed over an academic year, this documentary follows the students navigating the most formative years of their lives. Comedy drama, starring Baz Ashmawy

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis struggle to determine whether a death during a college-based clinical trial for a new antidepressant was murder or suicide, and receive little assistance from the institutions evasive psychiatric professor. A second students demise then leads to the revelation that the trials participants are all operating under the influence of a mind-altering drug, and that the lines between love, obsession and madness have become dangerously blurred. There seems to be no motive for murder, and no trace of poison found in the victims glass, but weeks later, when Sir Charless doctor friend Sir Bartholomew Strange dies in similar circumstances, he and Poirot team up to investigate. Drama, with Art Malik, Jane Asher and Anna Carteret, and David Suchet in the title role
